loans.name: Procura

texts.en:
Mrs. Procura B. is from the village of Tinago, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Procura is married to Antonio B. and has two school-age children. To make a living, she is presently engaged in a direct sales business particularly beauty products and also operates a mobile sound system for hire. She has been engaged in this kind of business for over 9 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Just this year, Procura joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a loan of 10,000 PHP. She is now requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP for her 2nd loan which will be used to purchase additional equipment for her sound system. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family especially for their basic needs, savings, insurance and for possible business expansion.

 About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase additional equipment for her sound system

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty J. is married and lives in Sitio Mapa-it, Brgy. Suay, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running two businesses:  a general store and a fishing operation. Her husband Arnolfo, who is 37, works as a carpenter and also helps his wife. They have two children who are 8 and 11 years old. 

Betty joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she wanted a better life for her family. With the help of her six previous loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Betty has been slowly lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her last loan, which was for PHP 23,000, helped her increase her profits to PHP 15,000 a month, and that meant a significant improvement in her family's standard of living. This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 27,000 to invest in her fishing business and general store so that she can continue to save for her children's education. Betty J. is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To expand a general store and a fishing business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a 49-year-old lady, married to Kevin, who is 52 years old and a farmer. They are blessed with six children, ages eight, 15,18, 20, 23 and 25. She has been running this retail shop for the last 10 years, which earns her 5,000 KES monthly. Due to the fact that her husband has been able to meet most of their expenses, this gives her room to grow the business.

She was introduced to Kadet by a friend, and this is her first loan. Francisca plans to add more stock, such as sugar, kerosene, rice and soda, to her retail business. She plans to use the expected profits to educate her children at the highest education level, and hopes to grow the retail business to wholesale in future.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her retail store

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 40 years old and married to Simon M., who is a farmer. The couple is blessed with three children aged eight, 12 and 15. She has been in the clothes hawking business for eight years, which earns her 10,000 KES monthly.

Regina has no history with any other MFI, and she is applying for her first loan of 20,000 KES to buy two bails of clothes to sell during the festive season. She was introduced to KADET by a friend, who has also benefitted from loans.

She is more successful because her husband assists in meeting their daily expenses. She anticipates using the expected profits to educate her children to the highest level possible. Her hopes and dreams are to own a house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase two bails of clothes to sell

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en: Mr. Vuthy C., who we see in this photo, is 31 years old and his wife, Mrs. Touch Vy is 30 years old. They live along National Road Number Six about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have been married since 2001 and have three sons. Two attend primary school and the third is too young to attend school. Vuthy has made a living painting cars for the last 11 years. His wife works in a garment factory. He is asking for a loan of $500 to repair the house where he and his family live

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina S. lives in the town of Trinidad. She is 27 years old, married and has three children who are 8, 6 and 3 years old. She and her husband make a living by vulcanizing rubber, and her husband also occasionally provides motorcycle transportation to people who live in their town. She and her husband have worked hard to build their business and sustain their family.

Cristina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to buy the materials they need to provide services to their customers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to to continue expanding it.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Savat

texts.en: Mrs. Savat C. (who we see in this photo) is 20 years old and her husband, Mr. Chea Loek, is 26. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, where Mrs. C. stays at home to do housework and raise their newborn infant. Her husband makes a living as a driver. She is applying for a loan to expand her house and add a foundation.

loans.use: To expand her house and add a concrete foundation

loans.name: La Rose Group

texts.fr: Zozo H. A. est entrepreneur, membre du groupe La rose,  âgée de 25 ans, marié, mère de 2 enfants, tous étudient confortablement. Son mari est chômeur. Elle fait le petit commerce de vente habits (pantalons, robes enfants, etc.). Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Il ya 4 ans, qu’elle est en activité. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima. Elle installe ses marchandises  au long de la rue ambiante, parfois elle est ambulante dans les avenues de la ville. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 8 pantalons. En plus, elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique.  La cliente Zozo H. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe La rose est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: Zozo H. A. is an entrepreneur and a member of the group "La Rose."  She is 25 years old, married, and the mother of two children who are both comfortably educated.  Her husband is unemployed.  She runs a small business selling clothing (pants, children's dresses, etc.).  She began her business with her own funds, which she got from her husband.  She has been in business for four years.  Later on, she received a loan from the IMF Hekima.  She sets up her merchandise along side of the walking path, and sometimes walks through the avenues of the city to sell her goods.  This new loan will allow her to restock with 8 pairs of pants.  Moreover, she hopes to open her own shop.  The client Zozo H. thanks Hekima for its work to help the impoverished who are excluded by classic banks.  It should be noted the the group "La Rose" is mostly made up of women.

loans.use: 8 pairs of pants

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Nunik

texts.en: Nunik D. was born in 1962 in Ljevan city. She is married and has three children and two grandchildren. Since 1995, she has made a living by buying and selling clothing. Every week she goes to Yerevan to buy merchandise for her business and make sure she has a good assortment of items to sell to her customers. Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to pay for the education of her children, her oldest daughter’s wedding and the costs her son incurred when he entered the army. She is applying for a loan for 600,000 AMD loan to buy more items to sell to her customers, including suits, blouses and sweaters. Business is always strong just before New Year’s Day, and this loan will allow her to earn a good profit and pay for the wedding of her younger daughter. This will be her tenth loan, and she was never late making a payment on the previous nine.

loans.use: To buy suits, blouses and sweaters to sell to her customers

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 54 years old and is married to Jane, who is a farmer. Jane contributes to meeting the couple’s daily expenses, thus allowing Stephan expand his business.  For the past 20 years, Stephen has been a photographer. 

Stephen is applying for his sixth loan with Kadet. He has successfully repaid his previous loans, which is an indication of his good business ability. He will use his current loan to buy a digital camera and will use his profit to open another photo studio. In the future, Stephen hopes and dreams of owning a large photo studio in the town center.

loans.use: to purchase a digital camera

loans.name: Carlos Raul

texts.pt:
Carlos Raul C. nasceu na Provincia de Inhambane tem 33 anos de idade casado e pai de 3 filhos de 4, 7 e 10 anos, os dois mais velhos e que vão a escola. Fez 12ª classe não concluiu devido a distância que o separa a faculdade. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e responsabiliza se pela sua mae que vive em inhambane enviando lhe 1.000.00mt por mês para despesas de casa..

Sai de Inhamabane para o Distrito de Namaacha no tempo da guerra, apos a sua chegada ele trabalha em casa das Irmãs Missionarias de Maria durante 3 anos, como criador de frangos. Mas porque o emprego não lhe dava tempo de continuar com os estudos, abandona o emprego e engressa a Escola onde faz a 12ª classe, de seguida começa a trabalhar nas TDM como servente, auferindo mensalmente 5.700.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda com ajuda do seu negocio ele consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, este é o quarto empréstimo de Carlos na Hluvuku  e terceiro com Kiva no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas, rede, barrotes e outros) para ampliação da sua capoeira. Os anteriores de (15.500.00 14.000.00 e 34.000.00) forao para compra e criaçao de pintos. 

Esta seguro que vai reembolsar antes do tempo determinado pois para elêm dos suas  actividades conta também com ajuda da sua esposa que e  Docente.
texts.en:
Carlos Raul C. was born in Inhambane Province. He is 33 years old, married, and the father of three children, 4, 7, and 10 in age. The two eldest children attend school. He went to school up to 12th grade but didn't finish because he lived too far away. He owns his own house and lives there with his family. He is also economically responsible for his mother, who lives in Inhambane, sending her 1000 meticals a month for household expenses.

He left Inhambane for Namaacha during the war, where he worked for the Irmãs Missionarias de Maria (Missionary Sisters of Maria) for three years raising chickens. But because his work kept him too busy to continue his studies, he quit the job and returned to school, which he attended up to 12th grade. He then started working for the Mozambique Telecommunications Company (TDM), earning 5700 meticals a month, which he uses for household expenses. Thanks to his business he is even able to save a little money in his bank account.

Carlos has never had loans from other banks. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku and his third with Kiva, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which he plans to use to purchase construction material (cement, sheet metal, mesh, joists, etc.) to expand his chicken coop. His previous loans (for 15,500, 14,000, and 34,000 meticals) were to buy and raise chicks.

He intends to pay back this loan back ahead of schedule, since besides his two incomes he can also rely on help from his wife, who is a teacher.

loans.use: Purchase construction material (cement, sheet metal, mesh, joists, etc.)

loans.name: Stephen Nyoro

texts.en:
Stephen has practiced dairy farming in Njabini town for the last 20 years.  He is 47 years old, married to Jane Njeri, and they have eight children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan.  He repaid his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.

In future, Stephen hopes to buy a lorry which he will be using to transport his milk to the market.  He will also be charging other farmers to transport for them.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Americo

texts.pt:
Américo B. nasceu na Província de Nampula norte de Moçambique tem 42 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, é pai de 4 filhos de 5, 8, 14 e 15 anos, todos vão a escola. Fez a 8ª classe não continuou devido ao trabalho que não o facilitava. Vive na casa própria com sua familia, não responsabiliza se por ninguém.

Américo sai de Nampula para Alemanha num curso de 10 anos financiado pelo Estado, e quando fazia o sétimo ano o estado interrope o curso alegando que fundo desponibilizado ja havia esgotado e manda os de volta a Moçambique, ele consegue arranjar um emprego numa Quinta onde trabalha a mais de 15 anos auferindo 3.000.00mt como guarda. E ainda proprietário de um estabelecimento na sua residência e criador de frangos de corte. Conta com ajuda da sua esposa consegue no seu negocio um rendimento de cerca de 10.000.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da sua casa, dos negócios e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e Kiva no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar pintos, ração e vitaminas para criação de frangos de corte. O anterior de 15.000.00mt foi para a mesma finalidade.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto porque conta com a receita do seu estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Américo B. was born in Nampula, Northern Mozambique. He's 42 years old, married and the father of 4 children ages 5, 8, 14 and 15, all attending school. He lives with his family in a house they own.

When he was younger Américo left Nampula to go study in Germany. When the 10 year state-funded course he was enrolled in was interrupted in the 7th year, due to budget problems, he was sent back to Mozambique, where he found a job as a security guard at a private home. He's been working there for the past 15 years, currently earning a salary of 3.000.00 mt. He also runs a small grocery store from home and raises poultry to sell. With the help of his wife, their business make 10.000.00mt per month, which allows them to pay for household and business expenses as well as save some money in the bank.

This is Américo's second loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. He will use the 25.000.00mt to buy baby chicks, feed and vitamins for his poultry business. He used his previous loan in the same manner.

He's confident that he'll be able to pay back his loan ahead of schedule, since he can count on the profits from his other business.

loans.use: to buy baby chicks, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia H. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 57 years old and married. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community.

Lydia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lydia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma G. is a 50 year old married woman who supports her family by operating a fishing business.  She lives in Nasipit, Brgy. Cabangahan, Siaton, Negros Oriental.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000. Wilma is now borrowing Php 20,000 so that she can purchase a new engine for her fishing boat. This will be her 4th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Wilma aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
At her young age (31 years old), Lea has become a successful businesswoman. She started her own business using the loan she received from ASHI. It was just a small business then, but because of so many trials in life, Lea strived hard to make it grow and expand. 

Lea feels glad about her business achievement. However, it is not yet stable enough for her to feel financially secure. Without a loan, her business can never grow. Therefore, Lea is requesting another loan in a larger amount to support and maintain her business (e-Load business). 

She hopes that by having this business, she will have more income, have more savings for the future of her only daughter, and will be able to help her other relatives by employing them to work with her in her business.

Her vision of giving her daughter a better future using the proceeds of her business enhanced her eagerness to explore the potentials of her business. Her husband has been so supportive of her business effort. Lea hopes with God’s guidance that she can comply with her loan obligation and give a decent life to her family.

Her long term goal is to secure a stable source of income, and to be financially independent. Lea will use the profits to give a better education to her daughter and save some of it to support and fulfill her business dreams.

loans.use: To support and maintain her business (e-load business).

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna B. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 49 years old and married. To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. Myrna works hard to improve her business and earn more.

Myrna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Myrna from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials.

loans.name: Alexandre Vasco

texts.pt:
Alexandre vasco C. nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique tem 38 anos de idade,fez a  6ª classe do antiga sistema não concluiu devido a falta de condições, vive maritalmente na sua própria casa. E pai de 6 filhos de 6 aos 12 anos todos vão a escola. Responsabiliza se pelo seu sobrinho que vive com ele em sua casa.

Alexandre sai de Chibuto para a vizinha Africa do Sul no tempo da guerra a procura de melhores condições de vida , anos depois devido ao (Apartheid) regressa e passa a viver com seu irmão no Distrito de Namaacha, este que  consegue aranjar um emprego como guarda numa quinta, Anos depois concorre para uma vaga como segurança no Hotel Xissaca. Hoje é funcionário permanente a mais de 6 anos auferindo mensalmente 2.750.00 mt que aplica nas dispesas da sua casa e ainda consague poupar 500.00mt na sua conta bancaria.

Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Alexandre na Hluvuku e primeiro com kiva no valor de 8.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas, cimento, pedra e outros) para a conclusão da sua obra. Os anteriores no valor de (5.000.00mt e 6.000.00mt) foram para a mesma atividade.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir mais ainda para manuntenção e pintura da mesma.
texts.en:
Alexandre Vasco C. was born in Chibuto, in the province of Gaza,Southern Mozambique. He is 38 years old, married, and the father of six children ages 6-12 (all attending school). He lives with his family and a nephew, whom he is responsible for, in a house they own. 

Alexandre left Chibuto for neighboring South Africa during the Mozambique civil war, in search of better living conditions. Years later, due to the Apartheid, he moved back to Mozambique to live with his brother in Namaacha. After working as a security guard at a private residence, he gets as job as a security person at Hotel Xissaca, where he has been for the past six years. His monthly salary of 2.750.00 mt allows him to pay for household expenses as well as to save 500.00mt in the bank.

This is Alexandre's third loan with Hluvuku and the first one with Kiva. He will use the 8.000.00mt to buy construction material (metal plates, cement, stones, etc) to finish building his house. His previous loans, in the amount of 5.000.00mt and 6.000.00mt, were used in the same manner.

He is confident that he will be able to pay back his loan ahead of schedule and plans to apply for more loans to finish building and painting his home.

loans.use: to buy construction material (metal plates, cement, stones, etc)

loans.name: Sansao Jamisse

texts.pt:
Sanção Samussone Jamisse M., nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Provincia de Maputo, casado e pai de 2 filhos de 1 e 4 anos de idade. Fez a 9ª classe não continuou porque teve que começar atrabalhar cedo. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta sua mãe que vive com ela em sua casa.

Nunca saiu do Distrito, após a morte do seu pai a vida fica dificil, e teve que começar a trabalhar muito cedo tendo assim que abandonar os estudos. Consegue então aranjar um emprego na Empresa G4S como segurança onde Trabalha em turnos onde opera ha mais de 3 anos auferindo mensalmente 3.800.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Este é o quarto empréstimo de Sansão na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, areia e outros). Os anteriores emprestimos de 7.000.00, 12.000.00 e 15.000.00mt forão usados para a mesma finalidade.

Esta  confiante que vai reembolsar  antes do tempo e pedir mais ainda para finalizar a sua obra, pois ainda tem muito trabalho pela frente.
texts.en:
Sanção Samussone Jamisse M. was born in Namaacha, a province of Maputo, Mozambique, where he still lives. He is married and the father of two children ages 1 and 4. His studies were interrupted after 9th Grade, when his father died and he had to start working to support himself. He lives with his family, as well as his mother, whom he supports, in a house they own.

For the past three years he has been working as a security guard for the company GS4 , earning a monthly salary of 3.800.00mt, which allows him to pay for household and construction expenses as well as to save some money in the bank.

This is Sanção's fourth loan with Hluvuku e the first one with Kiva. He will use the 15.000.00mt to buy construction material (cement, stone, sand, etc). His previous loans, in the amount of 7.000.00, 12.000.00 and 15.000.00mt were used in the same manner.

He is confident he can pay back his loan ahead of schedule and, as there's still much work to be done to finish the house, he plans to apply for more loans in the future.

loans.use: to buy construction material (cement, stones, sand, etc)

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en: Kadzo L. is a 66-year-old widow and a mother of six children. She sells makuti (traditional palm-leaf roofing) at Mjanaheri in Malindi town. The lady was introduced to KADET LIMITED by a client who is already registered with KADET. She has been in this business for the past six years. Kadzo is applying for her first loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings and plans to buy more materials for making makutis to sell to her customers. This will improve her daily sales. She intends to use the anticipated profit to help continue supporting her family as well as to expand her business.

loans.use: To add more stock

loans.name: Long's Group

texts.en:
Five people form this group loA., and they are located in Preaek Dach village in Kandal province. This group loA. selected Mrs. Long C., 40 years old, as the group leader. The members of this group will use their portions of the loA. to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Long C. earns her family's living by her two children's and her husband’s salaries. Her husband, Mr. Brakk Mai Va, 51 years old, and works as a government worker. They have five children: one is a laborer, one is a metal smith, and the others are students.

In order to support her child's metal smith business, Mrs. Long C. would like to ask for a loA. to purchase metal smith supplies to support the business.

loans.use: To purchase metal smith supplies to support her child's business.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia B. is from the town of Trinidad. She is married and has 3 children aged 18, 13 and 11.

Dionesia owns and manages a sari-sari (general) store. She sells tissues, candies and other various products. She is also an Avon dealer and displays Avon products at her store. Dionesia also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells pork meat at the market. Dionesia says she does all this to be able to help improve her family's living conditions.

Dionesia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dionesia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Dionesia is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to buy products to sell and additional piglets.

loans.use: To buy products to sell and additional piglets.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert U. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 30 years old and single. To make a living, Gilbert owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. Gilbert says he is saving for his future as he also wants to have his own family.

Gilbert joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gilbert has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Gilbert is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Siek's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consist of ten members, and they are located in Preaek Dach village in Kandal province. Mr. Siek S., 40 years old, is the village bank president, who was selected by its members. With the loans, they hope to increase their income to improve the living of their families. 

Mr. Siek S., is single, and is a laborer for which he can receive a little salary to support himself. With his laboring, he still earns little income to improve his living conditions. Thus, Mr. Siek S., would like to ask for a loan to build a chicken house, to buy chicken feed and to buy chickens for breeding. With the new loan, he hopes to increase his income to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To build a chicken house, to buy chicken feed and chickens for breeding.

loans.name: Joseph Esekon

texts.en:
Joseph Esekon L. is twenty-five years old, married to Eunice Tergwet, and together they have two beautiful children. They live in Eldoret Town, and Joseph buys and supplies meat to retail shops in town. He has been in this business for two years now and he gets a monthly income of ten thousand shillings. 

Joseph plans to buy more meat to supply and also diversify by buying maize in bulk so that he can sell in small quantities because it is maize season in Eldoret now. This will be his first loan in KADET and he plans to buy more meat to sell and also to buy a new motorcycle for his business so that he can supply meat to a wider area.

In future, he plans to educate his children to the highest level of education, and also buy more motorbikes for his business and also hire people to help him.

loans.use: To purchase meat for sale.

loans.name: Syinash's Group

texts.en:
Dordoy Bazaar is a major trading center of Bishkek, the capital of Kyrgyzstan. It’s not only the shopping epicenter of the whole region, but also a starting point of re-export of consumer goods from China to Kazakhstan and Russia. Kyrgyzstan is very lucky to have a market like this, because as experts say it is one of the largest and most profitable economic activities in Kyrgyzstan. Dordoy Bazaar provides employment for over 20,000 people including our client Syinash. 

Syinash K. , 49, applied for this loan in November. She sells men’s clothing by retail and makes her living for her and her fifteen year old daughter, who is in high school. She started her business fifteen years ago, and even after her husband passed away, she found the courage to raise her daughters and handle the business well. Syinash bought a special place for service and carefully followed the tastes of customers. Soon she was able to broaden the commodity circulation and get 23,000 soms a month. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase winter clothing. She relies on a high demand caused by growing population of the city. Syinash is thankful to all lenders and promises to repay the loan as soon as she can. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase winter clothing.

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.en:
Juvenal is 52 years old. He is married and has five children who are between eighteen and twenty-five years old. All his children go to school. Juvenal sells beans, sorghum and has a retail shop with clothes for women. 

He has been in this business for twenty years and he decided to request this loan to buy more beans, sorghum and children’s clothes. He is committed to buying a motor vehicle from the profits of his business and he would like to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 23 years old. She is married and has two children who are two and five years old. She works together with her husband in the business. Alphonsine owns a boutique and bar. She has had this business for a period of five years. 

She needs this loan to add more merchandise like lotions, cooking oil and battery cells in her business and she hopes to buy a plot of land and care for her family from the profit she makes. In the future, she would like to have a big retail shop.

loans.use: To add more merchandise for sale.

loans.name: Bonifride

texts.en:
Bonifride owns a boutique with different items. She is 25 years old and married to a businessman with two children who are between three and five years old. She sells various items such as beans, soaps, salt and rice. Bonifride has been in this business for five years. 

She has requested this loan to add more items for the growth of sales in her business. She expects to make savings and to purchase more merchandise with the profits, and dreams of having a large shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beans, soaps and rice to sell.

loans.name: Ruslan's Group

texts.en:
What do we need informational technologies for? In a contemporary world we cannot imagine life without a cell phone, computer or TV. The cell phone usage in Kyrgyzstan has risen dramatically in the recent five years. Almost every person right now has at least one cell phone. This growing consumption has caused the cell phone industry to grow very rapidly.

Ruslan N. is a part of this industry too. He is 21 years old and lives in a small Northern town, Karabalta. Ruslan has been selling mobile phones by retail since his teenage years. He spent 100,000 soms for his business start-up, and is earning 30,000 soms a month. Given a piece of advice from his mother, he took a loan from a bank, and repaid it successfully. Ruslan is married, and his spouse is an office manager for a local medical college. This couple has worked hard, and it has given them fruits. They have managed to broaden the business and purchase some furnishings. This loan is needed for adding cell phone accessories to his assortment of goods. The proceeds of business Ruslan plans to spend on a new automobile and maybe open his own store. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 46 years old. He is married and has three children who are between the ages of five and ten. Two of his children go to school except the youngest. His wife works with him in the business. Albert sells various products such as kids clothes, shoes, cooking oil and rice; he has been in this business for three years. 

Albert would like to use this loan to make his business grow and add more items for sale such as shoes, sugar and rice. With the profits from this business he will build a house. He says that his business allows him to get the basic needs for his family and he dreams of having a large shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more kids clothes, shoes and rice to sell.

loans.name: Khiev's Group

texts.en:
Eleven members form this  village loan, and they are located in Preaek Dach village in Kandal province. This village loan selected, Mr. Khiev Y., 68 years old, as the village bank president. The members of this village hope to increase their income with these loans. 

Mr. Khiev Y. and his wife, Mrs. Klork Yory, are farmers who own 1.50-hectare of land that they use to cultivate rice for a living. With this farming, they still earn little income to support the family. In order to improve the family's living conditions, Mr. Khiev Y. would like to ask for a loan to buy a fishing boat for fishing. 

They have two children: one is a blacksmith, and one is a farmer who supports the parents' farming.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat for fishing.

loans.name: Marie Therese

texts.en:
Marie Therese is 26 years old. She is married and has one child who is one year old. She and her husband work together in her business. Marie Therese owns a boutique in which she sells a variety of products and she has spent three years in this business. 

She needs this loan to buy more cooking oil, gas, soaps, salt and sugar. She hopes to provide food for the family and would like to start saving with the profit obtained from this business. She says that her business has allowed her to achieve many things.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, sugar and more for sale.

loans.name: Maricor

texts.en:
Maricor T. is a 39 year old married woman who supports her family by operating fishing and fish vending businesses. She lives in Purok 7, Brgy. Malabuhan, Siaton, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing and fish vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000.

Maricor is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase fishing gear and equipment. This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Maricor aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Marcilinda

texts.en:
Marcilinda C. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Tapi, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a carenderia/eatery business. Her husband Jose C., who is 49 years old, helps in his wife's business activities. They have 6 children who are 13 to 26 years old.

Marcilinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marcilinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 17th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the future and support her children's education. Marcilinda C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jeniffer Joseph

texts.en:
Jeniffer Joseph S. is a woman of 32 years. She is married to Joseph S. and together they have six beautiful children who are aged between 4 months and 11 years. They live in Ortum in West Pokot, where her business is. She has a retail shop where she sells maize and many other basic things like soap, flour, etc. 

Jeniffer gets a monthly income of 15,000 shillings. This will be her second loan with KADET and she plans to use the entire loan to buy more maize for resale. With the income she is going to get, she plans to save and use it later to diversify her business.

In the future, Jeniffer wants to open a wholesale shop, purchase a vehicle for transport and provide for her family basic needs.

loans.use: To add stock in the shop, e.g. buy maize

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria A. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 36 years old and married. To make a living, Maria owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Maria also helps her husband at their rice farm. She helps keep the farm free of weeds and pests.

Maria joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Maria is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Erenea

texts.en:
Erenea C. is a 36-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  pig-fattening and general store businesses. She lives in Prk. Yanog, Brgy. Tampalon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.

 By working hard in her pig-fattening and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Erenea is now borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she can fund her business operations. This will be her 4th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Erenea aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: working capital for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Altanchimeg

texts.en:
Altanchimeg P. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Hovd province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent and fence. Both her two sons stay at home. Her husband is a foreigner and helps her with the business. She operates a book sales business. She has been selling a variety of books for past 3 years and has built up a stable operation.

 In addition, she also teaches chess playing classes to children and young people. Both Altanchimeg and her sibling have master degrees in chess playing. She is a modest woman. She is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan for her chess teaching class.

loans.use: To expand chess playing class

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann D. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Tapi, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  meat vending and bakery businesses. Her husband Adilito D., who is 48 years old, helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 12 and 20 years old.

 Mary Ann joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 28 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mary Ann has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 29th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 which she intends to use as additional funds for her business operations so that she can continue to save up for the future and her children's education. Mary Ann D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: additional working capital for her businesses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Love

texts.en:
A known quote says, "In every cloud there is a silver lining". Love D., 34, believes life to be so. Love reached college and is married to Richard; together, they have three children, two of whom are in elementary school, while the third one is not yet of school age.  They presently live in Caloocan City, Philippines.

Love is in the direct--sales business. She sells silver accessories like necklaces, earrings, and rings to friends, neighbors, and business connections. Being eight years in business, Love uses knowledge based on experience and applies her learning from training in CCT* to make her business grow. Every month she earns around Php 8,250.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She intends to use this money to buy more silver accessories as well as products from the well-known beauty brand AVON in order to give her customers more options. She will also use the money to be able to deliver new orders to customers as soon as possible.

One challenge Love faces is that she cannot immediately get new orders and deliver them to customers since many of them do not pay their bill as soon as they get their previously ordered items. She then does not have sufficient money on hand to obtain new orders. However, Love finds ways to solve the problem and to make sure that finances in her business flow smoothly. Focusing on the silver lining of every cloud that comes her way, Love is determined to get a commercial space for her business. She continually prays for God's intervention in her life and in the life of her family, so that her children will be able to finish college and have a bright future.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: purchase of silver accessories and other products for sale

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
Dorris K. is 28 years old and is married with two children. She operates a tailoring shop at Kijiwetanga, Malindi. 

Dorris has been in this business for the last seven years. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who was already a registered member of KADET.  Dorris is now applying for her third loan of Kshs 22,500. She intends to use this loan to buy a modern sewing machine and additional cloth materials for making new dresses for sale. Dorris hopes that doing this will grow her business. She plans to use the anticipated profit to expand the business even more, so that one day she can realize her hope of owning a boutique.

loans.use: To buy a modern sewing machine and cloth materials for making new dresses for sale

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity S. is a married woman who lives in Purok Yanog, Brgy. Tampalon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating one business venture: a food vending business.  Her husband Hansel S., who is 29 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have one child who is three years old.

 Charity joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 3 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Charity has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 4th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 which she intends to use to purchase raw materials so that she can continue to save up for the future and support her children's education.  

Charity S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
This is Girlie O., 25, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Renato, and together they have three children, one of whom is already starting his elementary school while the other two are still toddling around at home. By the grace of God, Girlie has managed to support her children's schooling and living expenses. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday needs.

Girlie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling at piece rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Girlie dreams of being able to expand her business and live a healthy life with her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Risalie

texts.en:
Risalie V. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Kasoy, Brgy. Tabugon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: Ready-to-Wear clothing sales, buying and selling Herbal Products and Avon and Natasha Products sales.  Her husband Caleb V., who is 48 years old, helps in his wife's business activities.  They have one child who is 19. 

Risalie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Risalie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the future and for her son's education. 

Risalie V. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda E. is a married woman who lives in Prk.Kabugwasan, Brgy.Zone 3, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating one  business venture: a charcoal and firewood sales business.  Her husband Rogelio, who is 55 years old, works as a truck driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have six children who are 20 to 32 years old.

 Erlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Erlinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,500, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000 which she intends to use to buy additional stock of charcoal and firewood to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. 

 Erlinda E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams.
