As well as being a saleswoman, Sara is also a beauty stylist and she usually takes advantage of her customers' visits to offer them these services.  With the end-of-year season approaching, her sales and orders have increased considerably.  She dreams of opening a small store in which she can offer her products.  She believes that next year she will be able to carry out this project.

loans.use: To buy aftershave, perfume, cosmetics, sports clothes and ladies' accessories

loans.name: Nyirahabimana

texts.fr: Nyirahabimana Goreth est notre client depuis l’an 2009 elle a deux enfants entre 3 et 4 ans, son niveau d’etude est primaire. Elle a 36 ans , le prêt qu’elle sollicite est pour acheter 15 sacs de pommes de terre car elle fait ce type de commerce a nyabugogo et elle a un depot.son ambitio est de creer la confiance avec la bank en payant a temps et resolliciter ’autres credits  pour augmenter sa capital.
texts.en: Nyirahabimana Goreth has been our client since 2009. She has two children, 3 and 4 years old. She has finished primary school. She is 36 years loan. The loan she is seeking is for purchasing 15 bags of potatoes, for this is what she sells in Nyabugogo. She has a warehouse. Her goal is to build a relationship with the bank paying her loans on time and continue taking out loans in order to increase her capital.

loans.use: Purchasing 15 bags of potatoes for retail

loans.name: Leodan

texts.es: El señor Leodan nacido el 12 de Septiembre de 42 años  en Limoncito casado con la Sra.  Fátima con 3 hijos  tiene su casa en la misma parcela en Santo Corazón a 8 Km de Limoncito tiene 2 parcelas.                                                                                                                                                              El se dedica a la agricultura en una parcela tiene sembrando maíz y yuca, en la otra parcela tiene plantas completas de cítricos como naranja, mandarina, limón y otros, combina estas productos ya que dan en temporadas distintas y siempre tiene ingresos de cualquiera de estos productos, es dinero del crédito es para la compra de semillas, preparado de la tierra ya que así tendrá una buena cosecha, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Leodan, 42, was born on September 12 in Limoncito.  He’s married to Fátima and they have three children.  His house is located on the same property in Santo Corazón, 8 kilometers from Limoncito.   He owns two lots.

He is a farmer.  He grows corn and manioc on one lot and on the other he has citrus trees like oranges, mandarins, lemons and others.  He combines the products since they ripen at different times so he always has income from either one or the other.

The money from the loan is to buy seed and prepare the land so that his harvest will be a good one.  He is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: For corn and manioc crop care.

loans.name: Estelle

texts.fr: S. Estelle est mariée à TOVODOUNON Antoine, et est mère de cinq enfants. En plus de ses enfants, Estelle a un autre enfant à sa charge. Estelle  s'est installée au quartier Akossavié dans la commune d'Abomey-Calavi, depuis dix huit ans environs, avec sa famille. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Estelle n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et contribuer aux dépenses familiales, Estelle vend divers articles religieux à son domicile depuis environs quinze ans. C'est à Agbangnizoun, dans le département du Zou que Estelle se ravitaille. Estelle avait obtenu auprès de ALIDé, deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever un peu le niveau de son activité. Dans l'optique d'agrandir davantage son activité afin d'avoir plus de revenus, Estelle sollicite un nouveau crédit.
texts.en:
S. Estelle is married to Tovodounon Antoine, and is the mother of five children. In addition to her own children, Estelle has one other child in her care. Estelle has lived in the neighborhood of Akossavié, in the commune of Abomey-Calavi with her family for about the past eighteen years. Together the couple has various family expenses. Estelle has never attended school. Estelle is from Agbangnizoun, in the province of Zou. 

To support herself and contribute to her family's expenses, Estelle has sold various religious items from her home for about fifteen years. Estelle obtained and repaid two loans from the microfinance institution ALIDé, these loans helped her grow the level of her business. In order to further expand her business so that she can earn more income, Estelle is requesting a new loan.

loans.use: To purchase various religious items.

loans.name: Octavio

texts.es:
El señor Octavio es casado, tiene cuatro hijos en edad escolar, vive en casa de sus padres durante mucho tiempo, en la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz.
El cliente es técnico superior en electrónica, cuenta con un ambiente en su casa, el cual utiliza como taller eléctrico realizando armado de equipos de sonidos como parlantes y poderes entregando su trabajo en lugares comerciales de La Paz y El Alto, su esposa le ayuda realizando todo tipo de masitas(repostería) que vende en las tiendas de barrio. Es así como obtienen sus ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de material eléctrico para su taller y así poder aumentar sus ingresos.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Octavio is married and has four school aged children.  He has lived in his parents’ house, located in La Paz’s Tacagua neighborhood, for a long time.

He is a Master Electrician and has a workshop in his house that he uses as an electrical workshop.  He builds sound equipment like speakers and amps and sells his items in commercial sites in La Paz and El Alto.  His wife helps him making all kinds of “masitas” (pastries) that are sold in neighborhood grocery stores.  This is how they earn income for the home.

The requested loan is to buy electrical supplies he needs for the shop so that he can increase income.

This is his first loan and the socioeconomic evaluation done qualifies him favorably and he may have access to a loan.

loans.use: To buy electrical equipment for his shop.

loans.name: Micheline

texts.fr: Micheline est née en 1979 à Abomey dans le département du Zou. Mariée à Adi, un chauffeur, elle est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. La famille s'est installée depuis dix sept ans environs à Hêvié dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Le couple assure ensemble les besoins de la famille. Pour y faire face, Micheline mène comme activité la vente de produits vivriers (maïs, farine de manioc, etc.) depuis une dizaine d'année. Micheline s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi au marché de Cococodji. C'est la troisième fois que Micheline sollicite auprès de ALIDé un concours financier, en vue d'étendre davantage son commerce et de mieux répondre à sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Micheline was born in 1979 in Abomey in the province of Zou. Micheline is married to Adi , who is a driver, and is the mother of four children, all of whom attend school and are in her care. For the past seventeen years, the family has lived in the area of Hêvié, in the town of Sèmè-Podji. Together the couple takes care of the needs of their family. 

To cope with expenses, Micheline has been running a business selling food (maize, cassava flour, etc.) for the past ten years. Micheline purchases her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and also in Cococodji's market. This is the third loan Micheline is requesting from ALIDé, in order to further expand her business and better serve her customers.

loans.use: To purchase food for resale.

loans.name: Kukola Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
51-year-old K. Margaret is affliated with Kukola Development Group-Mukono.  She has been operating a small retail shop selling mostly soap, sugar, and bread for the last 16 years in Kirinya.  Her shop attracts people from all walks of life from the lowest, middle, and highest income earners in and around Mukono. 

She gives credit goes to her husband whom she says was the motivating force in getting her started in this business. Prior to that, she was selling mostly tomatoes.   Her business profits are 600,000 shillings monthly, and she says with this loan she will add more retail items to her shop.

loans.use: To purchase items to resell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Verónica vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos, en la zona de Bajo San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz, casada tiene 3 hijos, la actividad que realiza es la venta de comida, con esta actividad ella genera los ingresos para su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar arroz, fideo, y otros productos de primera necesidad que están subiendo de precio en el mercado, para poder abastecerse y tratar de no subir el precio de sus comidas para no perder sus clientes.

Es cliente de Impro desde hace dos años y paga muy bien; por el carácter social califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Ms. Verónica lives in her own house with her husband and children in the zone of Bajo San Martin in the city of La Paz. She is married with 3 children and the activity she carries out is food sales. With this activity she generates her family's income.

The loan she is requesting is to buy rice, noodles, and other basic supplies which are increasing in price in the market in order to be able to stock up on them and try not to raise the price of her food and lose her customers. 

She has been a client of Impro for two years and pays back very well. For her social character she qualifies to obtain a loan.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies such as rice, noodles, and more for her food-selling business.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Maria, es socia del Banco Comunal Obelisco, es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos. Maria se dedica la preparación y venta D. Chicharrones en el distrito D. Quinua. Aprendió D. este negocio D. sus vecinas, vio que preparaban y vendían bien, así que un buen día decidió abrir su puesto.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. chanchos y carne, para la preparación 
D. chicharrones.
A Maria le gusta las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal, porque le dan créditos para trabajar  y aprenD. mucho en las capacitaciones. Su sueño es poder abrir un recreo y que sus hijos sean profesionales
texts.en:
María is a member of the Obelisco (Obelisk) communal bank.  She is married, 50 years old and has five children.  She makes and sells chicharrones (fried pork) in Quinua district.  She learned this business from her neighbors.  She noticed what they maD. and that sales were good so one day she decided to open her own stand.

The loan she’s requesting will be used to buy pigs and pork to make the chicharrones.

María enjoys the communal bank meetings because they give her loans to work and she learns a lot during the training sessions.  Her dream is to open a café and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: To buy pork.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To pay school fees of his kids

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
El señor Máximo vive en casa alquilada con sus hijos en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, esta separado de la esposa y vive con sus hijos; trabaja como soldador en una empresa donde percibe un salario mínimo. Máximo pidió un préstamo anteriormente con el cual se compro una soldadora con la cual trabaja independientemente para poder generar mejores ingresos.

El crédito que solicita es para darle a su hija capital de operación para que ella inicie un negocio de venta de juguetes.


Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por el carácter social califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Máximo lives in a rented house with his children in La Paz’s Pasankeri area.  He’s separated from his wife and lives with his children.  He's employed as a Welder in a firm earning minimum wage.

Máximo requested a loan previously that he used to buy a welding machine.  He uses it to work independently thus earning better income.

This loan he’s asking for is to give his daughter working capital so that she can start a business selling toys.

He is a well-paying Impro client and his social characteristics qualify him for a loan.

loans.use: To buy toys to set his daughter up in business.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio   solicito 800 $us; trabaja como enfermera auxiliar en una clínica. Vive en la zona de Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto. Está casada y tiene un hijo pequeño de dos años.
 El crédito lo destinara para la continuación de sus estudios como fisioterapeuta, y así aspirar a un mejor cargo dentro  su trabajo. Es el tercer  crédito en impro y el segundo vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Roció requested $800 USD.  She’s employed in a clinic as a Nurse’s Aide.  She lives in the Rio Seco neighborhood of El Alto.  She’s married and has a two year old son.

The loan will be used to continue her studies to become a Physiotherapist and be able to aspire to a better position within her work.  

This is her third Impro and second Kiva loan.

loans.use: To pay educational costs to become a Physiotherapist and improve her income.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.fr: Chantal est née le 21 Août 1967 à Adja au Mono. Mariée à Marc, Chantal et son mari ont à leur charge six enfants, tous scolarisés, dont quatre sont leurs propres enfants. Il y a une douzaine d'année que la famille s'est installée à Akossavié dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Le couple assure ensemble les besoins de la famille. N'ayant jamais été à l'école, Chantal mène comme activité la vente de bouillie de maïs accompagnée de beignets faits à base de farine de blé à son domicile. Chantal fait ses approvisionnements à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Chantal exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année et a déjà obtenu deux crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Chantal sollicite à nouveau un crédit auprès de ALIDé afin d'augmenter le volume de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Chantal was born on the 21st of August, 1967 in Adja, in Mono. She is married to Marc. Chantal and her husband have six children in their care, all of whom attend school, four of whom are their own children. For about twelve years, the family has lived in Akossavié, in the town of Abomey Calavi. The couple takes care of their family's needs together. 

Having never attended school, Chantal has a business selling boiled corn fritters (made with wheat flour too) from home. Chantal gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Chantal has been in business for ten years and has already obtained two loans, both of which she repaid. Chantal is requesting another loan from the microfinance institution ALIDé, in order to increase the volume of her business and better satisfy her clientele.

loans.use: Buy bags of maize, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Kandahar Cluster Group 2-Lugazi

texts.en:
32-year-old high-spirited E. Moses makes common cause with Kandahar cluster group-Lugazi. This jolly and good-humored gentleman has for the last 7 years been plying a mobile phone accessories business in Lugazi Town.  It is a business venture he says he started with the persuasion of a close friend.  Prior to that, Moses was doing mostly odd jobs, working as a handy man technician in and around Lugazi Town. 

Moses is happily married with 2 kids and he says this business generates for him 100,000 shillings weekly. With this loan, he says he is going to purchase more phone accessories to resell.  He feels with this loan his business prospects will only get rosier, especially for the future.

loans.use: To purchase phone accessories to resell

loans.name: Gilda

texts.es:
Gilda  solicito 300 $us;  se dedica a la venta de miel de abeja al por menor en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad. Vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos en la zona Ballivián de la ciudad de El Alto; el esposo trabaja en su tienda vendiendo lubricantes de vehículos y otros, todo al por menor.

El crédito será utilizado en incrementar su capital de trabajo para comprar más miel de abeja de los productores para su venta posterior en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto.
 Es el tercer  crédito en impro y el primer vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Gilda is requesting $300 USD. She sells honey in small quantities at different fairs throughout the city. Gilda lives with her husband and children in the Ballivián district of the city of El Alto. Her husband works at a retail shop selling vehicle lubricants and other products.

This loan will be used to increase her operating capital for buying more honey from the producers so that she can resell it later at the fairs in the city of El Alto.

This is her third loan with IMPRO and her first through Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase honey to sell

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda, es socia del Banco Comunal Obelisco, es casada y tiene 5 hijos. Florinda se dedica a la venta D. artesanías en el Distrito D. Quinua. Los hijos D. Florinda realizan trabajos D. artesanía en cerámica, para vender sus trabajos, decidió abrir un stand D. artesanía, venD. bien, pues el distrito D. Quinua recibe muchos turistas ya sean locales ó nacionales.
El prestamo que solicita Florinda lo invertirá en la compra D. artesanías en piedra D. Huamanga y tejidos, para surtir su stand.
A Florinda le gusta las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal porque pueD. ahorrar y recibe capacitaciones por parte D. su promotora. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y que su hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Florinda is a member of the Communal Bank “Obelisco” (Obelisk). She is married and has five children. Florinda sells handicrafts in the District of Quinua. Her children create handcrafted works maD. of ceramic and then she sells what they produce. She decided to open a crafts stand and her sales have done well. Many local and national tourists come to the District of Quinua.

Florinda is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of stone crafts from Huamanga and woven fabrics to restock her stand. She enjoys the Communal Bank meetings because she is able to save and receiving training from the staff. Her dreams incluD. growing her business and seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: Purchase stone crafts & woven fabrics to sell

loans.name: Nubia Del Socorro

texts.es: Nubia F. mujer  casada y con 3 hijos en las edades de 3,5 y 10 años inició su negocio una vez su esposo quedó desempleado por un accidente laboral; ella inició con su propio equipo de cómputos haciendo transcripciones y aprovechando los colegios cercanos. Gradualmente empezó a generar muchos clientes que también requerían el servicio de fotocopiaje y compró su maquina para dar respuesta a esta demanda. Como le ha ido bien por su buen manejo empresarial,  cada día piensa en que cosas adicionar como valor agregado para extenderlo y lograr que algún día no solo ofrezca estos servicios sino también que se convierta en una papelería bien cotizada, porque mucho es el potencial de clientes en este sentido debido a que se encuentra en una zona escolar y esto ayuda a la demanda de estos productos. En la actualidad solicita su primer financiamiento a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, quiere agregar una fotocopiadora mas  con su credikiva y en un futuro no muy lejano fortalecer su negocio diversificando su oferta con papelería. Su sueño es sacar adelante a su familia y que esta,  su microempresa,  se convierta en una fuente de ingreso y empleo principal y cada día con más tecnología donde los estudiantes puedan acceder y aprender.
texts.en:
Nubia F. is a married woman with three children (ages 3, 5, and 10). She started her business after her husband lost his job because of an accident at work. Nubia started with her own computer equipment to perform transcriptions and take advantage of the schools nearby. Gradually she began building a large clientele in need of photocopy services, so she bought a copying machine in order to meet that demand. Nubia has done well at managing her business. Each day she looks for things to add that are of value so that her business can become a stationery shop along with providing services. She has the potential of gaining more customers since she is located near a school where there is a demand for paper products.

Nubia is currently requesting her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to buy another photocopier. In the not too distant future, she hopes to diversify her business by offering stationery. Her dreams include seeing her family get ahead, converting her microenterprise in to a strong source of both income and employment, and acquiring more technology each day that students can access and learn.

loans.use: Purchase a photocopying machine

loans.name: Kandahar Cluster Group A-Lugazi

texts.en:
34-year-old N. Marion says she has been operating her retail shop in Kandahar-Lugazi for 3 years. It is an enterprise she says she began with her own capital, mostly from the agricultural business she runs.  She says the inspiration to start the business was from her husband, who also helps her at her shop. 

Marion is a hardworking and devoted lady who belongs to Kandahar Cluster Group-Lugazi. Marion is happily married with 3 kids and she says her weekly profits total up to 100,000 shillings. For the future, she says she is looking to giving all her kids a worthwhile education. With this loan, she says she is going to purchase more retail general merchandise to resell.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to resell

loans.name: Maria Donitila

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Obelisco, es casada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos. Maria se dedica a la siembra de verduras y venta de alfalfa, frutas surtidas en el distrito de Quinua. Maria siembra las verduras desde muy niña, aprendió de sus padres, Maria lleva sus verduras al Mercado Nery García Zarate, ahí los distribuye entre sus caseras, luego compra alfalfa, frutas surtidas y los vende en el mercado de Quinua.
El prestamo que solicita Maria lo invertirá en la compra de frutas surtidas y alfalfa. 
A Maria le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal porque accede a los Créditos y puede ahorrar, aprende mucho de las capacitaciones que recibe sobre la familia, salud y negocio.
texts.en:
María, 42, is a member of the Obelisco (Obelisk) communal bank.  She’s married and has four children.  She plants fruit and sells alfalfa and assorted fruit in Quinua district.  She has been a fruit farmer since she was a little girl; she learned from her parents.

María takes her vegetables to the Nery García Zarate Market to sell among housewives.  She then buys alfalfa and assorted fruit to sell in Quinua’s market.

The loan María is asking for is to buy assorted fruit and alfalfa.

María enjoys her communal bank meetings because she can access loans and save.  She learns much during the training sessions on family, health and business.

loans.use: To buy assorted fruit and alfalfa.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es transportista publico, tiene un taxi para llevar pasajeros en la ruta inter-ciudades La Paz –El Alto; tiene dos hijos de 2 años y 6 meses respectivamente, vive en casa alquilada en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo utilizará para la compra de un motor para su taxi, pues ahora tiene unos problemas que tienen que ser solucionados inmediatamente para continuar trabajando.

 Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO y el primer vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Miguel works in public transportation.   He has a taxi to take passengers along the La Paz-El Alto intercity route.  He has two children who are 2 years and 6 months of age respectively.  He lives in a rented house in La Paz’s Pasankeri neighborhood.

He will use the loan to buy an engine for his taxi because it’s having some problems that need to be solved immediately in order to continue working.

This is his second IMPRO and first Kiva loan.

loans.use: To buy an engine for his taxi.

loans.name: Lucienne

texts.fr: Lucienne est née en 1976 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Lucienne est mariée à René et est mère de quatre enfants dont certains sont scolarisés. Il y a près de cinq ans que la famille s'est installée à Akossavié, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Lucienne vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les charges familiales. Pour assurer ses besoins, Lucienne vend des divers (pâtes alimentaires, couscous, conserves de tomate et de sardine, huile végétale, plats en séries, etc. dans sa boutique size à son domicile. Lucienne achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Lucienne est également une couturière, mais elle mène cette activité de façon secondaire. C'est la troisième fois que Lucienne sollicite auprès de ALIDé un crédit en vue de renforcer son activité et d'accroître son revenu.
texts.en:
Lucienne was born in 1976 in Ouidah, a historic city of Benin. Lucienne is married to Rene and the mother of four children, some of whom are attending school. It has been nearly five years since the family moved to Akossavié, in the town of Abomey Calavi. Lucienne helps her husband and with him provides for her family's expenses. 

In order to take care of her family's needs, Lucienne sells various items (pasta, couscous, canned tomatoes and canned sardines, vegetable oil, dish sets etc.) in a shop in her home. Lucienne buys her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Lucienne is also a seamstress, but that is a secondary business. This is the third loan Lucienne is requesting from ALIDé, she will use this loan to strengthen her business and grow her income.

loans.use: To purchase various products (pasta, vegetable oil, canned sardines, etc.)

loans.name: Pedro Ismael

texts.es: El señor Pedro Ismael V. R., es un hombre adulto de 53 años, casado que habita en el barrio de La Enramada, su esposa se dedica a realizar las tareas del hogar, ellos tienen 6 hijos todos son independientes, y sobreviven bajo sus propios ingresos económicos, ellos son agricultores desde hace 35 años, problemas de plagas han sido uno de los problemas a los que se han enfrentado Don Pedro a lo largo de todos estos años, fue con su esfuerzo que logro adquirir su terreno y aprender de esta actividad que se ha convertido en el sustento económico de su familia, él desea un Mantenimiento Fito Sanitario para sus cosechas que favorezcan a un mejor volumen de producción, con el crédito comprara fertilizantes, fungicidas y urea, esta inversión le permitirá  a futuro remodelar su casa para mejores comodidades para él y su esposa, para sus días de retiro.
texts.en:
Mr. Pedro Ismael V. R., 53, is a mature, adult, married man living in the La Enramada neighborhood.  His wife’s a housewife.  They have six children who are all independent and support themselves.

They have been farmers for 35 years.  One of the main problems Pedro has faced throughout all this time is infestations.  It was with much effort that he was able to acquire farmland and learn this activity that has become the source of income for his family.

He wants to provide proper care for his crops that will lead to increased production.  He will use the loan to buy fertilizers, fungicides and urea.   This investment will make it possible for him to remodel his house to make it more comfortable for him and his wife when they retire.

loans.use: For crop maintenance.

loans.name: Estrellas De Plan Autopista Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento ESTRELLAS D. PLAN AUTOPISTA es un banco nuevo, y la Sra. ARMINDA Tiene a su cargo la presidencia, ella se dedica a la venta comida en una parada D. minibús y  con el prestamos otorgado comprara insumos y abarrotes para la elaboración D. sus ricos platillos, así para poder seguir adelante y mejorando sus ingresos, ella es un apersona muy trabajadora. 
El Sr. CESAR ocupa el cargo D. secretario en el banco es una persona joven y se dedica a la venta D. celulares y es cajero en una empresa y con el préstamo a comprara celulares D. diferentes marcas y así variar su mercadería es soltero y muy pronto desea formar una familia.
Todas las socias son personas trabajadoras y con ganas D. superación se dedican a distintas actividades y están muy agradecidas con la institución.
texts.en:
'Estrellas D. Plan Autopista' is a new community bank.  Arminda is the group's president.  She sells meals at a minibus stop and will use her loan to buy supplies and groceries for making her rich dishes so that she can continue making progress and improving her sales.  Arminda is a very hard-working person.

Cesar is the group's secretary.  He is a young man who sells cell phones.  He is also a cashier in a company.  He will use his loan to buy different brands of cell phone so that he can offer a wider variety of merchandise.  Cesar is single and very soon he would like to have a family.

All the members of the group are hard-working people who have a desire to improve themselves.  They engage in a number of different business activities and are very grateful to our institution.

loans.use: To buy supplies and groceries

loans.name: Nuris Esther

texts.es: Nuris T. de 59 años de edad es una mujer muy trabajadora que vive en Carrizal un barrio muy alegre y de gran tamaño de la ciudad de Barranquilla, ella es madre de 5 hijos y su actividad productiva  es la venta de pescado, actividad que inició porque el padre de sus hijos era pescador, le apoyó esa iniciativa en su momento y con ella pudo sacar a sus hijos adelante y sostener su hogar cuando el no estaba. Así es que Nuris diariamente sale con su ponchera en la cabeza a vender pescado en las calles de Barranquilla, tiene muchos clientes fijos a quienes les vende de contado, pero a otros  le da crédito, eso si a un plazo corto. Su negocio reporta utilidades de un 50 a un 70% de acuerdo  a la subienda del producto. Nuris durante 4 años ha estado vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y ya tiene 7 financiamientos con este su credikiva, comprará pescado al pormayor, para venderlo a sus clientes que prepararán platos especiales en las épocas decembrinas. Nuris es una mujer feliz de la vida pues ella ha sido muy ahorradora, por eso gracias a su disciplina ha logrado aumentar los ingresos de su negocio y con ello adquirir su casa propia. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y convertirla en una saludable pescadería abierta al público todos los días del año.
texts.en:
Nuris T. is 59 years old.  She is a very hard-working woman who lives in Carrizal, a very cheerful and large neighborhood of Barranquilla.  Nuris has 5 children and her business activity is selling fish.  She started this business because her children's father was a fisherman.  He used to support her in this initiative and, through her business, she managed to get her children ahead in life and support her household when he wasn't there.

Every day Nuris goes out with her bowl on her head to sell fish in the streets of Barranquilla.  She has a lot of regular customers who she sells her products to for cash but she provides her products to some other customers on short-term credit.  Nuris' business reports profits of 50-70% according to the season.

Nuris has been working with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for 4 years and she has had 7 loans if you count this Kiva loan.  She will use her loan to buy fish wholesale to sell to her customers who will make special dishes during the month of December.

Nuris is a woman who is happy with life since she has been a good saver.  For this reason, thanks to her discipline, she has managed to increase the profits of her business and use these to acquire her own home.  Her dream is to expand her business and turn it into a healthy fishmonger's shop which is open to the public every day of the year.

loans.use: To buy fresh-water and salt-water fish wholesale

loans.name: Norberto

texts.es: El señor Norberto S. L., vive en el barrio La Borgoña, es casado y su esposa se dedica a realizar los trabajos del hogar,  él es un hombre mayor de edad y tiene 6 hijos casados que sobreviven bajo sus propios ingresos, el ha sido agricultor 30 largos años, en los cuales ha tenido diversos problemas de las tierras y las cosechas, tales como plagas y enfermedades, fue gracias a sus padres hace años atrás que logro  aprender de ellos esta actividad que ha sido el sustento económico de toda su familia, él solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos vegetativos que brinden un optimo Mantenimiento Fito Sanitario, que incrementen los volúmenes de venta, que a futuro permita realizar unas remodelaciones a su hogar que sean para su retiro y morar en un espacio agradable sus días de edad avanzada.
texts.en:
Mr. Norberto S. López lives in the La Borgoña neighborhood.  He’s married and his wife’s a housewife.  He is an adult with six married children who support themselves with their own income.  

He’s been a farmer for 30 long years.  During this time he has faced various problems with his land and crops like infestations and illnesses.  It was thanks to his parents that years ago he learned this skill which has been the source of support for his entire family.

He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and farming supplies that will bring about maximum care for the crops thus increasing his sales volume which will allow him in the future to do some home remodeling so that his home will be more pleasant for his retirement and old age.

loans.use: For crop maintenance.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama L. is married and takes care of three children. Ama sells a variety of items such as fruits, maize, and others, in Abura.  She has been doing this for three years. Her husband is a mason. 

Ama uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Ama will use the loan to purchase more fruits for resale. Ama plans to reinvest her new profit back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase fruits for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Radio Advertisements

loans.name: Alba Lorena

texts.es: Alba Lorena tiene 41 años, esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos pues han sido beneficiosos. Alba se dedica a la venta de leche, desde hace más de 6 años, que comenzó con este negocio. Inicio como un medio de vida necesario para su hogar, ya que este tipo de negocio es muy común, ella habita en la comarca agua fría en donde muchos vecinos son clientes estables ya que es un producto que diariamente se consume. Este crédito es para la compra de leche y así con el paso del tiempo aumentar su producción y su negocio.
texts.en:
This isn’t the first time Alba Lorena, 41, has requested a loan because they have been very beneficial.  She has sold milk for over six years.  She started the business as a way to earn a living for her household because this is a very typical kind of occupation.

She lives in the Agua Fría area where many of her neighbors are regular customers that buy from her daily.

The loan is to buy milk so that with the passage of time production and her business will increase.

loans.use: To buy milk.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia C. sells groceries and cosmetics at Akotokyir, near Abura. She is a single parent taking care of a child. She responsibly sees to the well-being of her family.  Her loan will be used to expand her grocery store. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the education of her child.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store

loans.name: Darling Maribel

texts.es: Darling Maribel, tiene 38 años su actividad es la venta de cosméticos.  Es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora. Los encargos que realizan sus clientes ya que la rapidez con que ellos obtienen los pedidos los pone muy contentos, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche ya que no le gusta andar muy tardes en las calles lleva 15 años con su negocio. Este crédito es para comprar lápiz labial, cremas, perfumes y otras cosas. Su sueño es tener un local donde vender sus productos.
texts.en: Darling Maribel is 38 years old.  Her business activity is selling cosmetics.  She is a very enterprising and hard-working woman.  Her customers make their orders and she fills them quickly because that makes them very happy.  She works from Monday to Saturday from 8.00am to 9.00pm.  She doesn't like staying out in the street any later at night.  Darling Maribel has been in this business for 15 years.  This loan will be used to buy lipsticks, creams, perfumes and other products.  Her dream is to have premises from which she can sell her products.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Moyopata-San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MOYOPATA-SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Sebastian, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es la Sr. Alejandro; el tiene 54 años de edad y es casado y tiene 5 hijos; El socio se dedica al negocio de carpintería, el tiene un taller donde fabrica diferentes muebles como camas,mesas,sillas y ventanas, el socio trabaja juntamente con su esposa y sus hijos, todos ellos realizan trabajos en madera y luego los llevan a vender a lugares como Quillabamba y Sicuani y aquí en la ciudad de Cusco lo vende en el centro comercial el Molino, el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de taller de carpintería. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar madera y materiales para fabricar los muebles.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, construcción, carpintería, transporte y tienda de abarrotes.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “MOYOPATA-SAN SEBASTIAN” communal bank which is located in San Sebastián district in Cusco province, Cusco department.

Alejandro, 54, is married and has 5 children.  He is a carpenter and has a shop where he makes different kinds of furniture like: beds, chairs and windows.  He works with his wife and children.  They all make wood items that they then go out to sell in places like Quillabamba, Sicuani and here in the city of Cusco at the El Molino Shopping Center.  He works from 6am until 10pm.  He wants to expand his carpentry shop and is asking for a loan to buy wood and other furniture making supplies.

The other members sell second hand clothes, are in construction, carpentry, transport and grocery sales.

He is grateful to all who share in his dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy wood and other furniture making supplies.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip plans to buy a termite and bedbug detection dog with this loan. Philip is a home inspector running his own business, F. Home Inspections. He inspects the condition of homes, checking for electrical, structural, or any other problem.  He also inspects for insects. “I have a pest control business license and I want to expand that side of my business. In a non-conventional way.”  With the rise of bedbugs across the country, Philip sees a real need for these services. “It’s becoming an epidemic.  …To be able to do an inspection of a house with a canine will be very valuable.”

One of the worst parts about bedbugs is the psychological impact. “It really messes with people’s heads,” and bedbugs are very hard to find. “On a typical inspection you have to pull carpets back, look at small crevices – you can’t really find them.”  That’s why Philip says inspections with a dog work well. “Even if we don’t find them, now the customers have the assurance that they’re not there.  And that’s providing another service, beyond finding it.  It’s peace of mind when you don’t find it.” 

Philip F. comes from a construction family – his father was a builder and his mother, a realtor.  For a few years Philip would buy houses to live in, rehabilitate them and then sell them. “Everything leads me back to construction.” In 2003, he went into business as a home inspector and opened his business.

The biggest challenge Philip has faced in recent years has been the slowdown in the economy and especially the housing market. “But our business has grown even in this declining market.  And I know the reason why. If you provide a service above what clients expect at a price less than they expect to pay, they’ll recommend you.  …it’s a win-win.  Everyone’s happy.”

During the winter months, Philip relies on savings to some extent.  “Our business generates significant income, but it’s cyclical.  People don’t move as much during the holidays, so they don’t inspect homes as much.  …You never know, being an independent business – there’s no guaranteed paychecks.  So you tend to be conservative when the market’s slower.”

Philip has been planning on getting an insect detection dog for about 18 months.  He first approached his bank. “They declined my loan.  After I applied to ACCION Texas-Louisiana, the bank reconsidered and offered me a loan, but I turned them down.  Because I was already set to close with ACCION.”

This loan will cover part of the cost of the dog and Philip’s expenses while going through handler training.  “It takes two weeks for them to train you, so I have to pay for hotels while that’s happening.”  Philip will pay for the rest out of his savings. “I will use the loan to bridge that gap.  I don’t get the dog until March, which is when business picks up.  That’s when most people start to move and house hunt.”

Philip is providing for his wife, two young sons and two step-daughters with this business.  Another reason why he wants to expand the business is because “eventually everyone has to retire.  In order to do that you need to generate passive income. Hopefully these two businesses will provide that for me and my family.  …When you get to be 60 years old you don’t want to be on a second-story roof, 80 feet in the air.  And then if my sons want to go into this business, they can do that.”

Philip advises other business owners that “you just have to take a chance.  You have to take a risk.  That’s what’s so cool about Kiva – there’s so many diverse people trying to take a chance. And I want to be part of that.”

Philip has been very excited to discover Kiva.  Since learning about it through his loan application, he has made two loans to other Kiva borrowers.

loans.use: Termite and bedbug detection dog

loans.name: 23 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
Banco de emprendimiento antiguo  que se encuentra en su 5to ciclo, integrado por 9 integrantes los cuales todos viven en la zona del km9.
La Presidenta es la Sr. Rita  de edad de 58  años , vive en la localidad  del km 9 doble via la guardia  hace 7 años. Su Negocio es la  venta de comida en su mismo domicilio frente al colegio cuenta con el negocio hace 7 años su Estado civil es casada  hace 20 años con  el señor Humberto que cuenta con la actividad de la elaboración de malla olímpica hace 5 años, tiene 2 hijos que ya son independientes, con el dinero del  crédito comprara abarrotes como aceite y azúcar Fideos y arroz por cantidad para la elaboración de sus riquísimos platillos. 
                                                                                                 Todos los clientes se sienten muy agradecidos con la entidad financiera por depositarles la confianza a su personas.
texts.en:
This is a well-established community bank that is in its fifth loan cycle.  It has 9 members who all live in 'km 9' district.

The bank's president is 58 year-old Rita.  She has lived in the town of 'Km 9 Doble Via la Guardia' for 7 years.  Her business is selling meals in her home, opposite a school.  She has had her business for 7 years.  Rita has been married to Humberto for 20 years.  His business is making wire mesh and he has been doing this for 5 years.  They have two grown-up children.  Rita will use her loan to buy groceries such as oil, sugar, noodles and rice in quantity so that she can make her delicious dishes.

All the members of the bank are very grateful to Emprender for having placed their trust in them.

loans.use: To buy groceries and supplies

loans.name: Janny Maribel

texts.es: La señora Janny Maribel A. G., es una joven de 29 años que habita en el barrio de La Francia, ella es casada y su esposo labora en la albañilería, ellos tienen 2 hijos menores de edad que se dedican a los estudios, ella es agricultora desde hace mas de 15 que se dedica a esta actividad, y uno de los principales problemas a los que se ha enfrentado ha sido la infección de plagas enfermedades de las tierras, fue con el apoyo de su papa que logro adquirir un terreno para sus siembras y la enseñanza de esta actividad, ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que le permitan instalar un mantenimiento Fito Sanitario que le favorezca a la producción y mejore día a día los niveles de ventas que beneficien a sus padres al sustentar el gasto económico que tendrán que enfrentar para l universidad de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Janny Maribel A. García, 29, is a young woman living in the La Francia neighborhood.  He’s married and her husband works as a bricklayer.  They have two minor children who are in school.

She’s been a farmer for over 15 years.  One of the main problems she’s faced is infection with plagues and illnesses in the soil.  He father helped her acquire farmland for her crops and taught her this activity.

She is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers that will allow her to provide good crop maintenance that will favor production and daily improve sales levels that will be of benefit to them as parents when they face the expense of their children’s university costs.

loans.use: For crop maintenance.

loans.name: Juana Ester

texts.es: La señora Juana Ester Benítez P. es una alegre mujer que reside en el barrio el  Prado de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Este barrio es uno de los más tradicionales y hermosos de Colombia, por este motivo fue declarado por el Ministerio de Cultura, Patrimonio Arquitectónico Nacional. La microempresaria se desempeñó durante muchos años como secretaria y luego de su retiro decidió dedicarse al comercio minorista de artículos femeninos. Al principio su clientela era pequeña, pero con el paso del tiempo fue creciendo entre amigos, vecinos, empleados de varias empresas y referidos. La señora Juana manifiesta ser una experta cazadora de ofertas que siempre está pendiente de los remates que realizan los almacenes de cadena. De ésta forma logra comprar artículos de primera calidad a excelentes precios. Usualmente los productos los vende para que se los cancelen en dos o tres partidas. Este es el segundo crédito que tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y su primer Credikiva que planea invertir en la compra de jeans, blusas, calzado, colonias, perfumes y accesorios femeninos. El volumen promedio mensual de venta es de $ 1.200.000 COP  y su margen promedio de utilidad es del 35%. La señora Juana vive en compañía de su hija menor, que es soltera y labora en una importante empresa de la ciudad desde hace 10 años. Se declara una mujer feliz que está próxima a pensionarse y disfruta mucho su trabajo porque le permite mantenerse activa, visitar con frecuencia a sus amigas y generar unos importantes ingresos  a la economía familiar. El intenso invierno que ha soportado en los últimos meses el país ha afectado las ventas, pero espera recuperarse con la temporada de fin de año.
texts.en:
Mrs Juana Ester Benítez P. is a cheerful woman who lives in El Prado neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla.  This neighborhood is one of the most traditional and beautiful in Colombia.  For this reason, it was named a national architectural heritage site by the Ministry of Culture.

Juana worked for many years as a secretary but gave up her job to work as a retailer of women's  products.  At first she didn't have many customers but, over time, her business has grown amongst friends, neighbors, employees of several companies and people who she has been recommended to.

Juana is an excellent offer hunter.  She is always on the look out for sales that chain stores offer.  In this way, she manages to buy high-quality articles at excellent prices.  She usually sells her products to her customers and allows them to make two or three payments.

This is the second loan that Juana has had with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and her first Kiva loan.  She plans to invest it in buying jeans, blouses, footwear, aftershave, perfume and women's accessories.  Her average monthly sales volume is 1,200,000 Colombian pesos and her average profit margin is 35%.

Juana lives with her youngest daughter who is single and has worked for an important company in the city for 10 years.  She says that she is a happy woman who is close to retirement age.  She enjoys her work a lot because it keeps her active and she gets to visit her friends often and make a lot of money for the family's finances.  The intensely-cold winter that the country has experienced over the last few months has affected her sales but she hopes to bounce back during the end-of-year season.

loans.use: To buy jeans, blouses, footwear, aftershave, perfume and women's accessories

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy phone cards and add cash to business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy used shoes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy petroleum products to sell

loans.name: Auntie Ama

texts.en:
Auntie Ama T. is married.  Ama sells maize, kenkey, and fried fish in Abura. She has no educational background.  Ama will use the loan to purchase more maize and fresh fish to fry to expand her kenkey business.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to reinvest in the sale of other cereals.

Ama is standing by a bag of maize and in her hand is a sample of the fried fish.

loans.use: To buy maize and fish to sell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian E. sells charcoal in both small and large quantities in Abura. She is married and has eight dependents. She assists her husband in feeding, clothing, and educating her dependents. Her loan will be used to buy additional bags of charcoal for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a storehouse.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca K. moves around in her locality to sell cloths at Abura. Rebecca has been in this cloth business for fifteen years. She is responsible for her own well-being. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase more cloth to be able to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a shop.

loans.use: To buy cloth to resell

loans.name: Nancy Esther

texts.es: Nancy V. es una mujer casada propietaria del negocio “La Terraza D. Nacho”, un sitio en el barrio las Palmas D. Barranquilla, ubicado en la parte externa D. su vivienda y rodeado D. arboles que refrescan la estadía D. quienes van a compartir sanamente y en familia la música y las bebidas. Este negocio  lo inició Nancy con la ayuda D. su esposo y D. sus hijos, aprovechando que frente a su casa está ubicada una cancha D. futbol, donD. practican ese deporte todos los días, y los fines D. semanas y festivos juegan partidos D. campeonato. Su mayor volumen D. ventas es justamente los días sábados, domingos y días feriados, porque la gente que juega en la cancha,  no solo se divierte con la música que suena, sino que también toman bebidas  refrescantes   junto a sus familiares, es decir los convierte en día D. integración familiar que disfrutan es esta mencionada terraza.  Nancy tiene 5 años D. pertenecer a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con su credikiva, el quinto financiamiento, comprará refrescos, bebidas y confitería,  pues se acerca el final del año lleno D. fiestas y con ello se aumenta el consumo D. bebidas, licores y confitería lo cual incrementará en un 20% la rentabilidad sobre la inversión, en tanto su rotación D. inventarios es D. 20 días,  su rentabilidad sobre las ventas 25%, la liquidez actual 3,1%, liquidez futura 2.1%, su capacidad D. pago con el crédito es D. 68% y su endeudamiento futuro 49% . Su mayor desafío es continuar fortaleciendo sus negocio con cada inyección D. capital que haga a su negocio, por eso valora mucho los créditos,  pues con ellos ha logrado ampliarlo y con ello contribuir con el sostenimiento D. su familia, así como adecuar su vivienda y hasta sostener una convivencia saludable, lo que la hace verdaderamente felíz.
texts.en:
Nancy V. is a married woman who owns the business 'La Terraza D. Nacho' (Nacho's Sidewalk Café) which is located in Las Palmas neighborhood in Barranquilla.  Her business is located outsiD. her home and is surrounded by trees that refresh the stay of people who pleasantly enjoy the music and drinks she offers, together with their families.

Nancy started her business with her husband and childrens' help.  She takes advantage of the fact that there is a soccer pitch opposite her home where people play soccer every day.  On weekends and on holidays, they play championship matches.  Nancy makes her largest number of sales on Saturdays, Sundays and holidays because people who play on the pitch don't only enjoy the music which is playing but also like to have refreshing drinks with their families.  They spend the day with their families in Nancy's sidewalk café.

Nancy has been a member of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for 5 years.  Her Kiva loan is her fifth loan and she will use it to buy drinks and confectionery since the end of year is approaching and it is filled with parties.  She hopes to increase her sales of soft drinks, alcoholic drinks and confectionery which will increase her return on investment by 20%.  Her stock turnover is every 20 days, her return on sales is 25%, her current liquidity is 3.1%, her future liquidity is 2.1%.  Her capacity to fulfill payment obligations with the loan is 68% and her future indebtedness is 49%.

Nancy's biggest challenge is to continue strengthening her business with each injection of capital that she makes.  For this reason, she very much appreciates the loans she receives because with them she has managed to expand her business, help support her family, adapt her home and even maintain a healthy relationship which makes her really happy.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, alcoholic drinks and confectionery wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a front wall on her property.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana de 25 años, tiene una pequeña tienda desde que su esposo se quedo sin trabajo. Vive en una zona urbana llamada suburbio, la zona es caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales. 

Ella y su esposo pasaron por una situación económica muy mala que tuvieron que pedirle ayuda a su mama para que les dé un espacio y ubicar la tienda en su casa para poder mantener a sus hijos. Desde ese tiempo ella ha trabajado desde las 06h15am vendiendo arroz, lácteos, bebidas hasta las 22h00pm. En la actualidad su esposo ya consiguió trabajo y ahora los dos están trabajando para mantener a sus hijos de 6 y 2 años. Para seguir con unos ingresos estables ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, azúcar, bebidas para su tienda. 

En el futuro quiere que su familia siga unida e incrementar con mercadería variada su tienda.
texts.en:
Diana, 25, has had a small grocery store since her husband lost his job.  She lives in an urban zone called Suburbio that is notable because most of its residents are informal merchants.

She and her husband went through a very bad economic situation and had to ask her mother’s help to set up a small store in their house in order to support her children.  Since then she has worked starting at 6:15am selling rice, dairy products and beverages until 10pm.

Her husband has gotten a job and both are now working to support their children who are 6 and 2 years of age.  In order to continue earning stable income she wants to use the loan to buy rice, sugar and beverages for her store.

She hopes her family will stay together in the future and to stock her store with varied merchandise.

loans.use: For rice, sugar and beverages.

loans.name: Yuri Anís

texts.es: La señora Yuri Anís H. R., es una joven de 24 años que se dedica a vender frutas y verduras, ella no tiene hijos pero espera mejorar sus condiciones económicas, para ofrecerle a su futura familia un lugar mejor para su desarrollo, ella ha tenido el apoyo de sus padres, y ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de abarrotes que incrementen sus ventas y le permitan ahorrar recursos económicos porque quiere retomar sus estudios de secundaria, y la adquisición de su casita para su futura familia, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora que labora con mucho ahincó para logras sus cometidos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yuri Anís H. R., 24, sells fruit and vegetables.  She does not have any children but hopes to improve her economic situation to be able to offer her future family a better place to grow up in.  

She has had support from her parents and now is asking for a loan to buy larger quantities of groceries to increase sales and be able to save some economic resources because she wants to restart her secondary school studies and acquire a small house for her future family.  She is a very enterprising young woman who works with much dedication to reach her goals.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Margarita Josefina

texts.es: La señora Margarita Josefina S. D. S. vive con su esposo en la ciudad D. Barranquilla. DesD. hace 6 años se dedica a fabricar figuras comestibles D. chocolates como caritas felices, corazones, caricaturas del ratón Mickey, pato Donald, papá Noel y logotipos D. empresas y hoteles. Este negocio comenzó como un pasatiempo para regalar detalles a los amigos y fue tal la acogida del producto que la usuaria decidió comprar más moldes y perfeccionar sus técnicas D. decoración. Actualmente sus figuras comestibles se venden en varios almacenes D. regalos, librerías, cafeterías D. escuelas y recientemente se han incrementado los pedidos D. varios importantes hoteles para regalarle a sus huéspedes un regalito y otras empresas encargan figuras con sus marcas y logotipos para obsequiárselas a sus empleados y clientes. Además D. la venta D. figuras comestibles, la usuaria alquila fuentes luminosas D. chocolates en fiestas, especialmente D. niños y jóvenes. Este es el cuarto crédito que tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y su primer Credikiva. Siempre se ha caracterizado por su puntualidad.  Planea invertirlo en la compra al por mayor D. chocolate y cuatro nuevas fuentes luminosas. El promedio D. ventas mensuales es D. $ 1.200.000 COP y el margen D. utilidad es aproximadamente del 45%. El próximo año la señora Margarita planea contratar una empleada y abrir un local al público para ofrecer mejor sus productos. En la temporada D. fin D. año sus ventas se incrementan considerablemente. La usuaria manifiesta que le encanta su negocio porque realizar y decorar las figuras es un oficio agradable que la entretiene mucho; asimismo, disfruta atender sus fuentes D. chocolates porque por motivo D. su trabajo se la pasa D. fiesta en fiesta.
texts.en: Margarita Josefina S. D. S. lives with her husband in the city of Barranquilla. For 6 years, she has been making edible chocolate figures of things such as smiling faces, hearts, Mickey Mouse, Donald Duck, Santa Claus, and logos of businesses and hotels.This business started as a pastime of making presents for friends, and it caught on so well that Margarita bought more molds and perfected her decorating techniques. Now her candies are sold in various gift shops, book stores, school cafeterias, and, recently, the orders from various hotels have increased so they can give the candies as a little gift to their guests. Other businesses order candies shaped like their logos to give to employees and customers. Besides selling candies, Margarita rents out lighted chocolate fondue fountains for parties, especially for children's parties. This is the fourth loan that she has received through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, and her first through the CrediKiva partnership. She has always been known for her punctuality. She plans to use the loan to buy chocolate wholesale as well as buy four new lighted fondue fountains. Her average monthly sales are $ 1.200.000 COP and the operating margin is approximately 45%. Next year Margarita plans to hire an employee and open a store where she can offer better products. During the end-of-year season, her sales increase considerably. Margarita says she loves her business because making and decorating the chocolate figures is a fun job that she greatly enjoys; also, she enjoys working with her chocolate fountains because this work has her going from party to party.

loans.use: Purchase chocolate wholesale as well as four new lighted fountains.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria M. had thought about starting a business for a while.  When she moved to Texas from California, she discovered a niche in the shoe business and jumped on the opportunity.  Her store, Madame Shoe & Accessories, specializes in giving customers a style of merchandise that they love.  During the last year Maria and her husband, Raul, have been busy running the business and raising their 10-month-old.  

Maria and Raul visited several banks to try to take out a loan without success.  The last bank they tried suggested that the couple look into ACCION Texas-Louisiana as another option.  The couple is very excited to receive a loan from ACCION. 
 
The greatest challenge for Maria has been to get the name of the business out into the community.  When customers come in they often say “I didn’t know you guys were here.”  The loan from ACCION is extremely important for the business because it will be used for advertising expenses.  The loan is providing the finances for newspaper ads, flyers, and other types of advertisements.  Maria and her husband hope to bring in many more customers with the boost in advertising.  Maria’s advice to other entrepreneurs is to “take the time and spend the money on advertising” as soon as the business opens.

loans.use: advertising

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: El señor Pedro Jose H., es un hombre de 51 años, casado y su esposa se dedica al comercio de las frutas y verduras, él es agricultor y cuenta con una experiencia de mas de 30 años, en los que se ha enfrentado a robos de cosechas que afectan su economia para nuevas inveriosnes en su negocio que le permitan mejorar sus niveles economicos, fue gracias a la Reforma Agraria que lograron adquirir su terrenos de siembra, y es para su negocio que solicita un prestamo para la compra fungicidas y fertilizantes, que aporten un optimo Mantenimiento Fito Sanitario, que mejore su produccion incremente sus ventas, y permita la remodelaciopn del piso y techo de su hogar, para habitar en un lugar digno y comodo sus dias de retiro.
texts.en: Pedro Jose H. is 51 years old, married, and his wife sells fruits and vegetables. He is a farmer with more than 30 years' experience, during which time he has dealt with people robbing the harvest, and that has affected his economic position for investing in his business and reaching new financial levels. It was thanks to Kiva partner Reforma Agraria that they were able to get their farm fields, and it is for his business that he is requesting a loan to purchase fungicides and fertilizers that contribute to optimal maintenance of healthy crops, which will improve his production and increase his sales. This will allow him to remodel the floor and ceiling in his house so he can live in a dignified and comfortable place during his retirement.

loans.use: Crop maintenance

loans.name: Samakarr Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Samakarr” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are small business people who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person in the group. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Adama T..  Adama was born in the town of Magburaka forty-two years ago. She is married and has four children – three in secondary school and one in college.

Adama is in the business of selling rice, groundnuts, salt, ginger, etc. She has been in this business for twelve years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy the above mentioned items in larger quantity to add to her current stock. This will eventually lead to improvement in sales and increase in profit for Adama. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: To buy rice, groundnuts, salt, ginger, etc. in large quantity

loans.name: Tamemsu New Site Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Tamemsu New Site” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are small businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to seek a loan of SLL 600,000 for each person in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Mamah K.. Mamah was born in Port Loka town about fifty-two years ago. She is married and has four children. Her husband is an imam and her children are no longer attending schools. 

Mamah sells cooked rice, uncooked rice, and palm oil. She has been a businesswoman for nine years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy rice, palm oil, etc. at wholesale to add to her business. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: To buy rice, palm-oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Wayna Taucaray Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “WAYNA TAUCARAY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Claudia; ella tiene 48 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia se dedica al negocio de venta de fruta, la socia vende diferentes variedades de frutas como platanos,uvas,manzanas,naranjas,papaya entre otras, la socia vende en el mercado llamado Los Nogales desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de fruta. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar frutas al por mayor.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de verduras, tienda de abarrotes, locutorio,venta de papa y venta de cosméticos.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The group members are part of the Wayna Taucaray Communal Bank. This bank is located in the Cusco district, in the province and department of Cusco.

One of the members is Claudia. She is 48 years old, married, and has three children. She has a fruit-selling business. She sells a variety of different fruits such as plantains, grapes, apples, oranges, papaya, and others. She sells in the Los Nogales market from 6 am to 7 pm. Through this small business, she helps her children succeed. She wants to expand and improve her fruit business. She is requesting this loan to buy fruit wholesale.

The other members sell vegetables, have a grocery store, operate a telephone booth, sell potatoes, and sell cosmetics.

Claudia is thankful to those who have been part of realizing this dream through Kiva, and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase fruit wholesale

loans.name: Marlita

texts.es: Marlita, de 43 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su hija y su nieta; juntas se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 16 años, esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulatoria. Esta muy satisfecha con su negocio, pues obtiene regulares ganancias de las ventas de su mercadería. Deja las prendas de vestir por pedidos a sus clientes, y cobra en ese momento porque no le gusta trabajar a crédito, ya que muchas veces se han demorado en pagarle. Ya se acostumbró a traer regular cantidad de ropa de la ciudad y la escoge de acuerdo a la temporada y la moda, además  trabaja  durante todos los días, pues dice que debe buscar nuevos clientes para obtener mejores ganancias. Y como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de venta de ropa en el mercado de su zona. Es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Marlita tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en ropa, pues tiene algunos pedidos y por campaña navideña quiere abastecerse de diversidad de prendas de vestir, de esta manera espera salir adelante.
texts.en: Marlita, 43 years old, lives in her own home with her daughter and granddaughter; they work together every day to move forward. For the past 16 years, this hardworking woman has had a business selling clothes in the open air (not out of a store-front). She is very satisfied with her business; she has regular income from the sales of her merchandise. She drops off the clothing orders with her customers and collects on them immediately because she does not like to work on credit since many times payments do not get made. She is accustomed to bringing a certain amount of clothing from the city, which she selects based on the weather and style. She works every day, and she says that she should look for new customers so she can have better revenues. As she is an enterprising woman, she plans to open a clothing store in the future in the local market. This is the fifth loan she has had with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to be punctual about making payments because she doesn't want to make a bad impression on the people who have made this support possible and who have allowed her to continue working and making progress. Marlita plans to use this loan to purchase clothes because she has some orders to fill and because the Christmas bells are ringing she wants to stock up on an array of clothing items. In this way she hopes to move forward.

loans.use: Purchase clothes to fill some orders that she has.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es: La señora Celestina G. V., tiene 47 años es madre soltera, y sus hijos son mayores de edad, que laboran y sobreviven bajo sus propios medios, ella se dedica a vender DVD de manera ambulantes desde hace mas de 3 años y fue con su esfuerzo propio que logro iniciarse en esta actividad ella habita en una pequeña casa la cual necesita unas remodelaciones de urgencia en la sala de su vivienda, ya que por el  paso de las fuertes tormentas que golpearon la capital, espera le brinden un apoyo económico puesto la falta de apoyo actualmente tiene sus hijos tienen sus propias familias, y no tienen los ingresos necesarios para cuidar de su madre, seria para ella de una gran tranquilidad el apoyo puesto que desea tener un hogar cómodo y digna para sus días de retiro.
texts.en: Celestina G. V. is 47 years old; she is a single mother, and her children are grown. They work and live on their own. She (Celestina) has been peddling DVDs on foot for more than three years and it was through her hard work that she started this business. She lives in a small house that urgently needs some remodeling in the living room because of the major storms that hit the capital. She hopes to get some financial help because her children could not help now since they have their own families, and they don't have the income they would need to care for their mother. It would be a great comfort for her to get this help that she is requesting so she can have a comfortable and dignified home for her days off.

loans.use: Remodel the living room in her house

loans.name: Verónica Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Verónica del Socorro T. tiene la edad de 45 años vive en el Barrio Villa Libertad, es casada y su esposo es transportista, ellos tienen 6 hijos mayores de edad, que trabajan para recibir y sobrevivir bajo sus propios ingresos, ella labora en una farmacia desde hace 2 años, ella y su esposo son el soporte de su familia con sus limitados ingresos, ellos tienen muchas necesidades en su hogar, y el paso de las fuertes lluvias que cayeron en los meses pasados en la capital deterioraron la infraestructura de su vivienda, es para su hogar que solicitan un préstamo para la compra y posterior remodelación del muro trasero de su casa, esot les  permitira un lugar digno, cómodo y seguro que mejore sus condiciones de vida, ellos reciben el apoyo de su hijo mayor sin la ayuda de este la economía de su hogar colapsaría, esperan les apoyen a mejorar sus niveles socioeconómicos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Verónica del Socorro T., 45, lives in the Villa Libertad neighborhood.  She‘s married and her husband works in transport.  They have six adult children that work to earn income and survive by their own means.  She has been employed at a pharmacy for the last two years.  She and her husband support the family with their limited income.  They have many needs in their home and the recent heavy rains that fell in months past in the capital deteriorated their house’s infrastructure.

It is for the home that they requested this loan.  It is to buy and remodel a rear wall of the house.  This will allow them to have a proper, secure and comfortable home that will improve their living conditions.

Their oldest son helps them out economically.  Without this help the economy of their home would collapse.  They hope they will be helped to improve their socioeconomic levels.

loans.use: To build a rear wall.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El señor Félix Ramón Servían, tiene 45 años, está casado con la señora Natividad de Jesús Cardozo con quien está viviendo más de  5 años, cuenta con 1 hijo, viven en la ciudad de Ybycui  en el Barrio Santa Teresita.
    Félix Servían se dedica al negocio de la construcción y refacción de viviendas, gracias a la responsabilidad y buen trabajo demostrada lleva trabajando más de 15 años  en la mencionada actividad, posee una clientela formada dentro y fuera de la zona.
      Ante el aumento de la demanda en el rubro de la construcción, se ve obligado a la compra de mas herramientas de trabajo para ofrecerles a sus clientes mayor atención y rapidez, motivo por el cual se acerco a la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya  con el fin de solicitar un crédito para poder cumplir con estas falencias.
texts.en:
Félix Ramón Servían is 45 years old.  He is married to Natividad de Jesús Cardozo with whom he has been living for 5 years.  He has one child.  They live in the city of Ybycui in Santa Teresita neighborhood.

Félix Servían builds and refurbishes houses.  Thanks to his responsibility and the good work which he does, he has been in this business for 15 years.  He has a regular customer base both in his district and outside his district.

The demand for his building work has increased so he needs to buy more work tools so that he can offer his customers a better and quicker service.  For this reason he is approaching Fundación Paraguaya to request a loan.

loans.use: To buy tools for his building work

loans.name: Sugey Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Sugey del Socorro A. M.,  tiene la edad de 33 años, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, un barrio de la capital conocido por la Policía Nacional como uno de los barrios más peligrosos por la delincuencia que amenaza a sus habitantes, ella habita en una humilde casa que con los años se ha deteriorado y necesitan unas remodelaciones para seguridad y comodidad de los suyos, ellos sobreviven con limitados recursos su esposo es Electromecánico pero las ofertas de trabajo han disminuido, y bajo sus propios recursos no lograran realizar sus planes, espera le apoyen a mejorar sus condiciones actuales de habitad.
texts.en: Mrs Sugey del Socorro A. M. is 33 years old.  She lives in Laureles Norte neighborhood which is known by the National Police as one of the most dangerous neighborhoods in the capital due to the crime that threatens its residents.  Sugey lives in a modest home which has deteriorated over time and needs some remodelling work to improve her family's security and comfort.  The family have few economic resources.  Her husband is an electromechanical engineer but work offers have fallen and they cannot carry out their plans using their own finances.  Sugey hopes that you will help them to improve their current living conditions.

loans.use: To build a wall

loans.name: Maria Hermandina

texts.es:
María de 43 años, se dedico a coser ropa para ayudar en los gastos familiares ya que tiene 4 hijos con su esposo de 19, 18, 13 y 11 años de edad. Ellos viven en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo. 

Desde hace un año atrás ella comenzó con su taller de costura y confección debido a que el dinero que ganaba su esposo no les alcanzaba para mantener a sus hijos.  Con una péquela máquina de coser ha venido trabajando desde hace un año. Ubico su taller en una parte que readecuo de su casa ya que por ahora no tiene dinero para ubicarla en otro lugar. Cada costura la cobra en un promedio de $ 1.00 según sea el tamaño. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas y hilos para que su negocio este aumentando. En el futuro quiere tener un local propio y tener una cartera de clientes alta.
texts.en:
María, 43, went into clothes making to help with household expenses because she and her husband have four children who are 19, 18, 13 and 11 years of age.  They live in an urban zone called Guasmo.

She started her sewing workshop a year ago because her husband’s salary was insufficient to support the children.  She has been working for a year with a small sewing machine.  She set up her shop in part of her house that she equipped for this because she doesn’t have money to set it up anywhere else.  She charges on average $1.00 for each repair depending on size.  She works from 8am until 7pm every day.

She wants to use the loan to buy fabric and thread so that the business can grow.  In the future she’d like to have her own locale and a large customer base.

loans.use: For fabric and thread.

loans.name: Luz Y Prosperidad Group

texts.es:
Luz y prosperidad

Julia tiene 39 años de edad lleva el cargo de presidenta de la alcancía comunal “luz y prosperidad” el cual tiene ya mas de 1 año trabajando con Edaprospo-Prosperidad esta y esta conformada hace 4 años por 9 personas que llegaron a conocerse por que son vecinos y le pusieron el nombre de “Luz y Prosperidad” simplemente por que todo el grupo les pareció bien el nombre.
Julia es madre soltera convive con su pareja y mantiene a sus 3 hijas que son menores de edad Julia comenzó vendiendo golosinas ahora  tiene 1 año vendiendo ropa (AMBULANTE)  de esa manera puede mantener a sus 3 hijas junto a su pareja que le tanbien aporta a los gastos del hogar los cuales son Comida, Estudios, ETC  Julia quisiera tener un capital de trabajo para poder alquilar un puesto de vende en el mercado de su localidad y así siguir adelanta como la persona trabajadora que es.
texts.en:
Light and Prosperity
