She will use this loan to buy clothing. Her dream is to have her own home since she is now living with her parents.

loans.use: Purchase clothing.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es: La señora Lucinda es la presidenta del grupo “Los Girasoles” que tiene 7 miembros y 2 años trabajando con Edaprospo,  tiene 43 años y esta conviviendo, tiene 3 hijos D. 22, 20 y 18 años. Ah trabajado por 15 años en su bodega llamada “La Cabañita”, la cual inicio para ayudar a su esposo después D. su accidente, lo cual lo dejo invalido. Gracias a  la ayuda D. su parroquia ella inicio este negocio y sigue agrandando con la ayuda D. Edaprospo. La bodega ayuda el mantenimiento D. su hogar. Ella espera  que Edaprospo ayuD. a mejorar la calidad D. vida D. cada uno D. los miembros del grupo.
texts.en: Señora Lucinda is president of the communal bank “Los Girasoles” (The Sunflowers), which has 7 members and has been working with Edaprospo for 2 years.  She is 43 years old and lives with her partner.  She has 3 children who are 22, 20 and 18 yeras old.  She has worked in her small grocery store, called “La Cabañita” (The Little Cabin), for 15 years.  She opened the store in order to help her husband after an accident that left him disabled.  The grocery helps to sustain her household.  Thanks to the help of her Parrish, she was able to start the business.  And it keeps growing with the help of Edaprospo.   Sra. Lucinda hopes that Edaprospo can help improve the quality of life of each of the members of the communal bank.

loans.use: To purchase products and supplies

loans.name: Alex Manuel

texts.es:
Alex de 23 años, tiene un pequeño Cyber-cabinas desde hace años para poder solventar sus gastos de la universidad. Vive en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento descubrieron muchas flores y en la actualidad hay un parque de estas flores. 

Comenzó a investigar en el sector donde vive si había algún cyber ya que su sector es urbano y el nunca encontraba un lugar donde hacer sus trabajos. Compro algunas computadoras con sus ahorros y le instalo los programas para que funcionen como el quería.  En la actualidad trabaja desde las 09h00am todos los días ofreciendo la hora del internet a $ 0.60 y servicio de cabinas telefónicas. 

Con el préstamo quiere aumenta su negocio por eso quiere comprar computadoras. En el futuro quiere expandir el negocio y comprar maquinas a un volumen alto.
texts.en:
Alex is 23 years old and has had a small Cyber-cabin (internet café) for a few years to help meet his university-related expenses. He lives in an urban zone called Orquídeas - named "orchids" because when this area was discovered it had many flowers and today there is a park of orchids.

He began to investigate this business idea in his neighborhood by determining if there were an internet business in this urban area as he never found a place where he could do his work. He bought some computers with his savings and installed software so that the computers would function as he wished. Today he works from 9:00 AM every day offering internet service for $0.60 and also telephone service.

With the loan he wishes to expand his business so he wants to buy computers. In the future he wants to expand the business and buy machines in high volumes.

loans.use: Buy computers

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío tiene 42 años de edad, es una madre de familia amable y estricta en sus labores, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Rocío, está felizmente casada con un albañil, maestro de obras, con quien tiene un pacto de negocio. Ya que les provee comida a sus trabajadores, vendiendo diario de 25 a 30 porciones, negocio que le ha dado proporcionado muchas rentas. Es así que madruga muy temprano por la mañana, para preparar los alimentos, siendo almacenados en táper, puesto que serán trasladados al centro de trabajo de los albañiles. Han transcurrido 3 años realizando esta labor, que desea construir su casa de material noble hasta el segundo nivel, para acondicionar habitaciones para sus hijos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene pagar sin retrasos, y se compromete a cumplirlo, ya que anhela acceder a posteriores ayudas. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar accesorios de cocina y renovar táper de plásticos para su negocio y así continuar trabajando con la venta de comida.
texts.en:
Rocío, 42, is a kind mother who is very strict with her work.  She lives in her own house with her husband and three children.  She is happily married to a bricklayer, a master construction worker, that she has a business partnership with.  She provides meals for his workers; she sells 25 to 30 portions daily.  This is a business that has been very profitable.

She rises very early in the morning to prepare the meals that are then stored in Tupperware because they will be transported to the bricklayers’ work site.

She has been in this business for three years.  She wants to build her house out of substantial materials up to a second story to furnish bedrooms for her children.

This is her second loan with MFP.  She knows that she has to pay on time and commits to do so because she wants to be able to access future loans.

She will use the requested loan to buy kitchen accessories and new Tupperware for her business so that she can continue with her business selling food.

loans.use: To buy kitchen accessories and new Tupperware.

loans.name: María Adoración

texts.es:
La Señora María C. es socia del banco comunal La Estancia, vive en la comunidad de la Estancia que pertenece al cantón Paute, este cantón se caracteriza por la belleza natural de sus paisajes, es de clima templado, en sus tierras se cultivan las mas hermosas flores, su gente es de un corazón muy calido y amable.

La Señora. María tiene  55 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos  de 42 y 37 años de edad quienes son casados y viven independientes. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, gracias al trabajo y sacrificio del trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña María se dedica a la cría de cuyes, pollos, vacas, cerdos, pavos, patos y muchos animales mas, actividad que realiza hace varios años, también se dedica a la agricultura  siembra hortalizas, todos sus productos y  los animales los vende en su propia comunidad.
 
Es el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal, fue incentivada por su vecina a ingresar al banco. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento. Su sueño es conservar su salud.
texts.en:
Mrs. María C. is a member of the La Estancia communal bank.  She lives in Estancia which is in Paute canton.  This canton is characterized by the natural beauty of its scenery, its moderate climate.  Beautiful flowers are grown in its land and its people are warmhearted and kind.

María, 55, is married and has two children who are 42 and 37 years of age.  They are married and live independently.  Her husband’s a farmer and raises animals.  Thanks to the work and sacrifice of them as a couple they have managed to build their own house.

María raises guinea pigs, chicken, cows, pigs, turkeys, ducks and many other animals.  She’s been doing this for many years.  She also farms vegetables.  She sells all her farm produce and her animals in her own community.

This is the second loan she’s had with the communal bank.  She was motivated to join by a neighbor.  She will use the new loan to buy chicks and feed for them.  Her dream is to stay healthy.

loans.use: To buy chicks and food for them.

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza de 32 años, es madre de dos niños y esposa de un comerciante, realiza la actividad de venta de víveres de primera necesidad. Pero antes de tener su tienda ella sacrifico mucho para conseguir lo que ahora tiene. Una de las cosas fue caminar recorriendo las calles de Guayaquil vendiendo artículos de casa. Pero como no le fue bien en esa actividad decidió comprar víveres de primera necesidad y venderlos a sus vecinos. 

En la actualidad su esposo le ayuda comprando los productos para la tienda mientras que ella los vende desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. En su tienda vende la libra de arroz, a $ 0.30, enlatados a $ 1.20, litro de aceite a $ 0.57. 

Para continuar con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cajas de aceite, lácteos, quintales de arroz, etc. En el futuro quiere aumentar su negocio con una restructuración de ambiente y mercadería.
texts.en:
Maritza, 32, is the mother of two children and the wife of a merchant.  She sells groceries.  Before having her store, though, she sacrificed much to have what she now has.  One of the things was having to traverse Guayaquil’s streets selling items for the home.  Because she did not do well in this business she decided to buy groceries and sell them to her neighbors.

Currently her husband helps her buy products for the store while she sells from 7am until 10pm every day.  In her store she sells a pound of rice for $0.30, canned items for $1.20, and a liter of oil for $0.57.

To stay in business she needs to use the loan to buy cases of oil, dairy products, quintals of rice, etc.  In the future she’d like to increase business restructuring the ambience and the merchandise.

loans.use: For cases of dairy products, oils.

loans.name: Juntos Unidos Iremos Al Camino Del Exito Group

texts.es: Rosa, es la presidenta del grupo “Juntos Unidos Iremos al Camino del Éxito” el grupo está conformado por 13 miembros que a su vez son amigos y vecinos que tiene como objetivo alcanzar metas en conjunto. Entre ellos  está la presidenta Rosa D. 41 años D. edad casada y madre D. tres hijos D. los cuales uno a un está a su cuidado por ser menor D. edad. Rosa es dueña D. un locutorio y cabinas D. internet por lo cual este es su único medio D. ingresos económicos, cuenta con este negocio hace más D. tres años, el cual le ha dado una economía estable en su hogar. Con el reciente préstamo piensa invertirlo en la compra D. mercadería como, tarjetas D. recargas virtuales para teléfonos celulares. En el futuro le gustaría abrir un restaurant y continuar con el negocio D. locutorio. Así como Rosa cada integrante del grupo, tiene una meta en particular, que es el éxito y la mejoría económica para ellos y sus familias.
texts.en:
Rosa is President of the “Juntos Unidos Iremos al Camino del Éxito” (Together as One We’ll Go to the Road to Success” group.  The group has 13 members who are friends and neighbors whose objective is to reach their goals together.

Among them is the President, Rosa, 41.  She’s married and mother of three children one of whom is a minor and still in her care.

Rosa owns a telephone booth and Internet access booths which are her only source of income.  She’s had the business for over three years.  It has provided her home with stable income.

She plans to use the recent loan to buy merchandise like telephone service recharge cards and virtual recharge cards for cellular phones.

In the future she’d like to open a restaurant and continue with the telephone booth.

Like Rosa, each member of the group has a particular goal which is success and economic improvement for themselves and their families.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora. Silvia R. es socia del banco comunal La Estancia, vive en la comunidad del Cabo que pertenece al cantón Paute, este cantón se caracteriza por la belleza natural de sus paisajes, es de clima templado, en sus tierras se cultivan las mas hermosas flores, su gente tiene un corazón muy cálido y amable.

Nuestra socia tiene de 33 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 9, 7 que son gemelos y 4 años de edad, todos sus hijos  estudian en una escuela de la comunidad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Silvia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar en donde cuida de sus hijos y también aprovecha el tiempo para dedicarse a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas, cría animales como cerdos y cuyes, todo lo vende en su propia comunidad.
 
Se encuentra en la banca comunal hace 4 años y le gusta ya que tiene muy buenas amigas y los créditos le benefician en sus negocios. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes. Su meta es  llegar a tener un negocio propio de cualquier actividad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia R. is a member of the La Estancia communal bank.  She lives in Cabo which is in Paute canton.  This canton is characterized by the natural beauty of its scenery.  It has a mild climate and beautiful flowers are grown in its fields.  Its people are warmhearted and kind.

She is 33 years old, married and has four children who are 9, 7, and 4 year old twins.  All the children go to the local school.  Her husband is a private employee.  Through their work as a couple they’ve managed to build their own house.

Silvia is a housewife dedicated to caring for her children but she also uses her time to farm.  She grows vegetables and raises animals like pigs and guinea pigs.  She sells everything in her own community.

She has been in the communal bank for 4 years.  She likes it because she has good friends there and the loans are beneficial for her businesses.  She will use the loan to buy guinea pigs.  Her goal is to have some kind of a business of her own.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora. María R. es socia del banco comunal La Estancia, vive en la comunidad de la Estancia que pertenece al cantón Paute, este cantón se caracteriza por  la belleza natural de sus paisajes, es de clima templado, en sus tierras se cultivan las mas hermosas flores, su gente tiene un corazón muy calido y amable.

Doña María se dedica hace varios años a la cría de animales como son cerdos, cuyes y pollos a los cuales los vende en su propia comunidad, actividad que aprendió gracias a sus padres y le ayudado a sacar en adelante a su familia.
 
La Señora. María tiene 40 años,  vive en unión libre  y tiene 4 hijos de 20, 17, 7 y 2 años de edad, su primera hija pasa en la casa y ayuda en los quehaceres, su segundo hijo trabaja pero solo para sus gastos personales, su tercer hijo estudia en una escuela del sector. Su esposo es de profesión chofer, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 4 años y le gusta porque los créditos le benefician en su trabajo. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes. Su meta es  sacar  adelante sus hijos para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Mrs. María R. is a member of the La Estancia communal bank.  She lives in La Estancia which is in Paute canton.  This canton is characterized by the natural beauty of its scenery.  It has a mild climate and beautiful flowers are grown in its fields.  Its people are very warmhearted and gracious.

For several years María has raised animals like pigs, guinea pigs and chickens that she sells in her own community, an activity she learned from her parents and that has helped her support her family.

She is 40 years old and lives in a common law union.  She has four children who are 20, 17, 7 and 2 years of age.  Her oldest daughter stays home and helps with the household chores.  Her second son works but just to meet his personal expenses.  Her third son goes to the local school.  Her husband is a driver by profession.  Their work as a couple has resulted in their being able to build their own house.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 4 years.  She likes it because the loans are beneficial to her work.  The money from the loan will be used to buy guinea pigs.  Her goal is to move her children ahead so that they will have a better future.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana de 38 años,  siempre le gusto coser y confeccionar ropa pero como no tenía mucha experiencia decidió inscribirse en una institución que enseñan manualidades llamada “SECAP”. Viviendo en una zona urbana comenzó a promocionarse como costurera y confeccionista. 

Con la dedicación que utilizo para que su negocio creciera le ayudo para que la gente del sector la conocieran y tenga una clientela fija. En la actualidad trabaja  desde las 09h00am en su casa donde ubico su taller de costura y confección debido a la falta de dinero hasta las 18h00pm. Entrega vestidos por un valor de $ 25.00, blusas a $ 12.00, camisetas a $ 5.00 etc. 

Ella tiene muchas aspiración para su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo telas, hilos, accesorios para confeccionar mas ropa. En el futuro quiere incrementar el taller para poder dar trabajo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Ana, 38, has always enjoyed sewing and dressmaking but not having much experience she decided to enroll in an institution that teaches manual arts called “SECAP.”  Living in an urban zone she started to promote herself as a seamstress and dress maker.

The dedication she used to help her business grew helped her become well known in the area and have a steady customer base.  She currently works from 9am until 6pm in a dressmaking shop she had to set up at home for lack of funds.  She makes dresses for $25.00, blouses for $12.00, t-shirts for $5.00, etc.

She has many hopes for her business and wants to use the loan to buy fabric, thread and accessories to make more clothes.  In the future she’d like to expand her workshop in order to employ other people.

loans.use: For fabric and thread.

loans.name: Silvia Emerita

texts.es:
La Señora. Silvia O. es socia del banco comunal Génesis, vive por el sector de Ucubamba en la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza que encierra a sus alrededores, su centro histórico fue nombrado como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es muy amable y de un corazón calido.

Doña Silvia tiene 37 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 16, 15 y 12 años de edad y todos s estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como operador de maquinaria pesada, no tienen casa propia lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora Silvia realiza  manualidades y por el momento esta haciendo adornos navideños, también realiza todo tipo de costuras actividades que aprendido por habilidad, lleva 6 meses en esta actividad. En sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo como es de la marca Esika y a esta labor se dedica hace 8 meses.

Es el quinto crédito que realiza y lo va a invertir para la compra de una maquina de coser. Su meta es tener un negocio propio donde venda sus manualidades.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia O. is a member of the Génesis (Genesis) communal bank in Cuenca’s Ucubamba sector.  This city is renowned for the beauty that surrounds it.  Its historic city center was named Cultural Patrimony of Humanity.  Its people are very gracious and warmhearted.


Silvia is 37 years old, married and has three children who are 16, 15 and 12 years of age.  They all go to a local school.  Her husband is a heavy machine operator.  They do not own a house; they rent.

Silvia makes crafts and is currently making Christmas decorations.  She also does all kinds of sewing, a skill she learned on her own.  She has been in this occupation for 6 months.  In her free time she sells catalogue cosmetics of the Esika brand.  She’s been doing this for the last 8 months.

This is her fifth loan and she will use it to buy a sewing machine.  Her goal is to have a business of her own where she sells her crafts.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose de 22 años, es empleado de una compañía llamada “Puerto Limpio” el es el guardia y trabaja desde muy temprano en turnos rotativos en ocasiones en la madrigada y otras en el día. 

El está separado actualmente de su esposa por eso vive con la mama y el hermano en  una zona urbana llamada suburbio está ubicada o caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes de clase baja. El quiere tener un negocio en el futuro ya que no quiere depender de un empleador porque quiere general dinero para mantener a su hijo que recién tiene 11 meses de vida. 

Para poder ayudarle a la mama para que tenga su casa mejor construida (aparece en la foto la casa) él quiere comprar con el préstamo materiales de construcción como cemento, bloques, masillas.  Su aspiración es seguir trabajando para darle una buena vida a su hijo y ayudar a su mama en la casa.
texts.en:
José, 22, works as a guard for a company called “Puerto Limpio.”  He works very early on rotating shifts sometimes at dawn and other times during the day.

He is currently separated from his wife so is living with his mother and brother in an urban zone called Suburbio which is notable because most of its residents are low-income merchants.  He wants to have a business in the future and not depend on an employer because he wants to earn money to support his newborn, 11 month old, son.

To help his mother have a better build house (the house appears in the photo) he wants to use the loan to buy building materials and supplies like cement, concrete blocks, plaster.  

His hope is to continue working to provide a good life for his son and to help his mother with the house.

loans.use: For cement, sand and stone.

loans.name: Nanci Marcelina

texts.es:
La Señora. Nanci Gonzáles es socia del banco comunal Génesis, vive por el sector de la ciudadela Calderón en la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza que encierra a sus alrededores, su centro histórico fue nombrado como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es muy amable y de un corazón cálido.

Nuestra socia tiene 73 años, es viuda hace 26 años y tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad, 5 son casados, uno de sus hijos casados vive en su casa y comparte los gastos, su hija soltera trabaja y le ayuda en la economía de su hogar, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Nanci se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa por catálogo, actividad que desempeña hace 10 años, no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo y vende a sus amigas y conocidas.

En la banca comunal se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo y los créditos le han beneficiado en la compra de mercadería, ahora con su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa y cosméticos para la temporada navideña. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nanci Gonzáles is a member of the Génesis (Genesis) communal bank.  She lives in Cuenca’s Calderón sector.  This city is renowned for the beauty of its surroundings.  Its history city center was named Cultural Patrimony of Humanity.  Its people are very kind and warmhearted.

She is 73 years old and was widowed 26 years ago.  She has six adult children.  Five of them are married.  One of her married sons lives in her house and shares expenses.  Her single daughter works and helps with household expenses.  She does not own her house; she rents.

Nanci sells cosmetics and clothes via catalogue sales.  She has been in this business for 10 years.   She does not have a fixed work schedule and sells to friends and acquaintances.

She’s in her fourth cycle with the communal bank and the loans have helped her buy merchandise.  Now the new loan will be used to buy more clothes and cosmetics for the Christmas season.  Her dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Mrs. Khann Thul Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people make up this village bank loan in Trapeang Khnaor village in Takeo province. Mrs. Khann T. is the village bank president, selected by the other members.  The members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes.  

Mrs. Khann T. is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where she is able to grow rice to sell to support her family.  She is also a chicken breeder. Although she tries to work hard, she only earns a small income.  To improve her family's daily income, Mrs. Khann T. is asking for a loan to buy four piglets for breeding to start a new business.  With the rest of the loan, she is going to buy one hundred more chickens. 

She is a widow with three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are studying at the local public school.

loans.use: To buy piglets and chickens to raise and sell

loans.name: Mrs. Inn Samoeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loA. consists of nine people who are living in Prey Ta Mau village in Takeo province. Mrs. Inn S. is a village bank president who has been selected by the other members.  The members will use their portion of the loA. in various ways to support their families.

Mrs. Inn S. owns a general store in the local village where she is able to earn a large profit to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Saroeun Ley, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support his family.  

Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. To improve this business, Mrs. Inn S. is applying for a loA. to buy more groceries.  With the rest of the loA., she is going to hire a plow machine to plow their rice field. She is a mother of a child who is a student.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell, and plow rice field

loans.name: Alyn

texts.en:
Alyn is from the village of Toril, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.  She is 38 years old, married, and has four children. To make a living, Alyn owns and operates a retail (sari-sari) store, selling to local community members. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In August 20, 2009, Alyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She had fully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used as additional capital for her sari-sari store.  She is now requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP to use as additional capital for her store. This will be Alyn 3rd loan from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as working capital for convenience store

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en:
Sourn P. is a 64-year-old widowed woman who currently lives with her children in Phnom Penh City. Sourn P. was married, but her husband died several years ago.  She has two daughters – one is married and lives away from home, and the other is single.  All of them are working in the construction field as workers. They share responsibility with her to support the family’s daily expenses. 

Sourn P. possesses some farmland that she inherited from her grandmother. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. She planted rice and vegetable crops two months ago, but her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy seeds and a few sacks of fertilizer for her crops to grow well.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Soth

texts.en:
Soth S. is a 32-year-old single mother. She lives with another family in the city of Phnom Penh. She owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandparents. She plants different kinds of crops on her land, such as cabbages, cucumbers, and morning glories, which she sells to buyers every two months when the plants mature. 

She has a life partner in her daughter, who always assists her in growing crops in the field. This family can earn an average profit of $5 per day to use for all their expenses. Currently, Soth S. has another farm that she owns, but she is not planting crops on it. Soth S. hopes to use her Kiva loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers to grow crops.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mr. Toem Ten Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Trapeang Ta Moung village, Takeo province there are eighteen people who are made up a village bank loan group. They have selected Mr. Toem T. to become a village bank president. They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes which can improve their family living standard. 
Mr. Toem T. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he grows rice to sell to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Chy Khoem, owns a general store in the local village where she is able to earn a profit to support the family. Since his wife’s business is going well, he wants to expand its sales. To improve this business, he is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell. He is a father of four children, one of whom is a student while the other two are employed in a garment factory. Another child  is employed in at private compaN..

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Thor's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes in Sla village, Takeo province. They have selected Mrs. Thor S. to become a group leader. 

Mrs. Thor S. is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land where she is able to grow rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. S. Nang Hiem, is a construction worker. She has a labor problem because it's time to harvest her rice field, but she did not have enough money to hire farm laborors. So to improve production, Mrs. Thor S. is asking for a loan to hire farm laborers to harvest the rice. She is a mother of four children, three of whom are students while the other works at home.

loans.use: To hire farm laborers to harvest rice

loans.name: Naida

texts.en:
Naida R., from the village of Manamong, Aloran, Misamis Occidental is 38 years old, married and has 3 children. To make a living, Naida owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector running a farm in local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In August 14, 2008 Naida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC used to add her capital from her business, she is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP for additional capital. This will be Naida seventh loan from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital of her farming business

loans.name: Mrs. Mak Aun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mak A. is a village bank president who has been selected by nine members that made up a village bank loan group. They live in Roka Khpos village, Takeo province. 

She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land to grow potatoes and beans to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Touch Hieng, is a palm juice collector who is able to earn some money from selling palm juice and palm sugar. She has some problem because her husband does not have enough equipment for collecting palm juice. So to improve this business, Mrs. Mak A. is requesting for a loan to buy some supplies for this purpose. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are attending in public school while the youngest one is six months.

loans.use: To buy palm juice collecting supplies.

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
This group loan of five people live in Samraong village in Takeo province. They have selected Mrs. Sary H. to become a group leader. They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes that can improve their family living. 

Mrs. Sary H. is a chicken and duck breeder who is able to earn some money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Vechet Key, is a laborer and fisherman. Although they work hard, they earn only a small income. To improve their daily income, Mrs. Sary H. is applying for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business. With the rest of the loan she is going to buy more chickens. 

She is a mother of two children, who all are enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy some piglets

loans.name: Chrou

texts.en: Mrs. Chrou M., age 28, is a vegetable seller who lives and operates her business in the City of Phnom Penh. Mrs. Chrou M. sells all vegetables grown by her husband. She has a life partner with her husband who is a local farmer, and he earns his living by planting various vegetable in his farmland which come from his grandmother. Mrs. Chrou M.'s husband has planted crops such as peanuts and some fruits over three month ago, but his crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To resolve the situation, she would like a loan for her husband to buy some fertilizer and seeds for planting. This couple have two children who are single and studying in school.

loans.use: To buy some fertilizer and seed for planting.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Phalla V. is a 21-year-old man, and married to Mim Channa, age 26, who is a local farmer in Phnom Penh City of Cambodia. This couple has given birth to two children,and two of whom are single. Phalla V. could earn a living by planting various crops on his own farmland which come from his grandparent. Phalla V. presently plants different kinds of vegetables, which he will harvest when they are mature. Unfortunately, his crop is not growing well because his farm is outside of a watering system. So that Phalla V. would like a loan to purchase a machine that he uses to pump water for his crops.

loans.use: To purchase a machine that he uses to pump water for his crops.

loans.name: Uong's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has six members who live in Srae Kaes village in Takeo province. Mrs. Uong K. is the leader of this group loan and has been selected by the other members. They will each use their portion of the loan for a different purpose that can improve their family living.

She and her husband, Mr. Nhorn Nhan, are farmers who own a one-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell and support their family. She has some problems in her rice field, because her field is far away from any irrigation system. To improve production, she is asking for a loan to buy a water pumping machine and with part of the loan, she will buy rice seed. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a water pumping machine to irrigate her rice field

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
In Trapeang Khnaor village, Takeo province,  these four members are taking a group loan.  Mrs. Kong T. is leads this group loan and she was selected by the other members.  Each of them will use their portion of the loan for different purposes so improve their family's living standards.

She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice to sell to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Thy Tey, is a horse cart driver and a laborer.  Although they try to work a lot, they earn very little income.  To improve her income, Mrs. Kong T. is applying for a loan to buy some ducks and duck food to start a new business in duck breeding. 

She is a mother nine children, two of whom are employed in a casino club while the other five are studying in a local public school and the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy some ducks and duck food to start a duck breeding business.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
The woman shown in the picture is Mrs. Heang C., and she and her husband are farmers in Phnom Penh.  Mrs. Heang C., 26 years old, is a humble mother who has two young children who attend school.  

Since 2000, she has been cultivating rice on her farmland that she inherited from her grandparents.  Her husband also works with her on the farm. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year.  Dry weather is expected in the beginning of this year, and it may affect Mrs. Heang C.’s business. She faces a difficult season if she is not able to irrigate her crop.  Mrs. Heang C. is taking out her loan to purchase a machine that she can use to pump water for her crops.

loans.use: To purchase a machine to pump water for her crops.

loans.name: Mrs. Suy Sophal Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of twenty people who are living in Sman Pream village, Takeo province.  Mrs. Suy S. is the village bank president who was been selected by the other members.  Each of them will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family's standard of living. 

She is a chicken seller in the local market where she is able to earn profits to support her family.  She is also a pig breeder, while her husband, Mr. Kusorl Soa, is a driver who gets a low salary to support his family.  They work a lot but they earn little income.  In order to improve her income, Mrs. Suy S. is applying for a loan to buy a cow to start a new cow breeding business.  She is a mother of two children who are both students. 

All the members are shown in this picture but one of them is blocked.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a new cow breeding business.

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Svay N., 26, is a busy man who is trying to earn money to support his family.  He and his wife have one child, who still lives with them under the same roof. This couple make their living by growing various vegetables on their farmland. Svay has been working in this sector since 2001, and earning an income of approximately $5 per day, which he uses for his family’s daily needs.

Svay's plot of farmland is medium sized. He plants vegetables like cabbages and cucumbers, but his farm is far from a watering system. Hence, Svay is looking for a loan to purchase an irrigating machine to pump water for his vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase an irrigating machine to pump water for his vegetables

loans.name: Mrs. Ker Saroeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The 18 people who make up this village bank loan live in Sman Pream village, Takeo province. Mrs. Ker S. is the village bank president. She has been selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

She is a farmer and owns a small piece of land, which she uses to grow rice to sell to support her family. She is also a chicken breeder. Her husband, Mr. Ren Chan, is a soldier who gets a low salary. He uses his salary to support his family, too. They work hard, but still they can earn only a little income. So to improve her family's her income, Mrs. Ker S. is requesting a loan to purchase a cow for breeding to start a new business. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are employed at a garment factory, while the other is attending a local public school.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for breeding

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Gantumur T. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. His oldest daughter and son both attend university, and his youngest son attends a local high school. Gantumur's wife helps him with his business. He operates a vegetable trading business, where he plants and grows a variety of vegetables on his own three hectare field to sell to dealers in the local markets. 

He also owns a bee farm, which consists of 19 beehives. During winter months, he keeps his bees in a special cellar, and in May he travels through the countryside to pasture his bees. When he has gone to migrate his bees, his children and wife are responsible for growing the vegetables. He started his vegetable planting business in 1992, and has since built a stable operation. Since 1998, he has been producing honey. 

During the past 12 years he has gained a lot of agricultural experience and knowledge of both his businesses. The family sells their seeds and honey during the warm months. They pickle their vegetables and sell those during the winter months. All family members are very hardworking people. Gantumur is a modest and experienced business man and says, "we work very hard during all warm months." He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of seeds while the price for such products is cheap.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of seeds

loans.name: Keat

texts.en: The woman in the photo is Mrs. Keat K., age 43, who lives in the Province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia, where she earns a living raising pigs. She has been running this business since 2006, and it has provided her with income to attain a decent standard of living. She is married with seven children, and all of them are single. Two of Mrs. K.'s children have been working different jobs in Phnom Penh, and they always share their earnings to support the family. Her husband is a fisherman, as well as firewood seller. In order to earn extra income, Mrs. K. wants to get a cultivating machine to provide a tapping rice service for other farmers. As she lacks money to buy one, Mrs. K. has decided to request a loan from Kiva. Mrs. K. will use these funds to buy a machine to begin providing her service.

loans.use: To buy a rice cultivating machine

loans.name: Mr. Ten Seang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has 17 people, who have selected Mr. Ten S. to become the village bank president located in Pou Bay Village, Takeo province. All the members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes, to improve their family's living standard. 

Mr. S. is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land that he uses to grow rice to sell to support his family. He is also a village chief in this village, while his wife, Mrs. Chrun Norn, is a pig breeder. In his rice field, he has some problems because his field is infertile. To improve production, Mr. S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the remainder of the loan he is going to buy some pig food. This couple has two children, one of whom is a motorbike taxi driver, while the other is a student in public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Oyunbat

texts.en:
Oyunbat, 31 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia.  They all live in a house. Her elder two daughters are attending local secondary school, and the youngest daughter stays at home. She has been operating a  retail business selling accessorized felt boots since 2000. She purchases felt boots and accessorizes them for resale. She adopted this business from her husband, and after years of operation, she has managed her working capital and with the earnings she purchased a family car and a plot of land for the house which they built recently. 

In the summer time she also operates a different business, a leather saddle cloth making business with her husband. Now her business is getting busy and she already has her regular customers who buy accessorized felt boots. In the future she is planning to expand her business and to have her own factory. Therefore she is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase 200 pairs of felt boots to accessorize.

loans.use: loan to purchase 200 pairs of felt boots to accessorize

loans.name: Mrs. Taet Eth Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The nine people wH. make up this village bank loan group live in Pou Bay village, Takeo province. They have selected Mrs. Taet E. to become the village bank president. They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' living standards. 

Mrs. Taet E. and her husband, Mr. Han Loeng, are farmers wH. own a more than 2-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support their family. She is a pig breeder, too. 

She has some challenges, both in farming and breeding because her field is infertile and she wants to breed more pigs, but she does not have enough money. Mrs. Taet E. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and two piglets. She has five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another one is a laborer, another lives with aunt and two others are students.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and two piglets

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel G. is a 53-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store business.  She lives in Prk. Yanog, Brgy. Tampalon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP10,000. 

Raquel is borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her fourth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Raquel aspires to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tsetsegsuren

texts.en:
Tsetsegsuren B. is 32 years old and lives with her husband and infant son in the Hovd province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband works in the military army, while her son is taken care of by her parents. 

Tsetsegsuren operates a clothes trading business out of a stall at the local market in her town. She started her business in 2006 and has built a stable operation since then. She has plans to expand her business in the near future. Her goal is to one day have her own clothes retail shop. 

She is requesting a 200,000 MNT loan to buy more pants from Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia.

loans.use: To purchase more pants at wholesale price

loans.name: Mrs. Soem Sopheap Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people make up a village bank loan group in Samraong village, Takeo province. Mrs. Soem S. is the village bank president, selected by the other members. Each member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

She and her husband, Mr. Sophan Ken, are farmers who own a more than 1-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support their famiL.. He is an door-to-door ice-cream seller, earning some of the income to support his famiL., too.

 In her rice field, she has some challenges because the field has infertile soil. To improve production, Mrs. Soem S. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan, she is going to purchase a cow for breeding to start a new business. She is a mother of two kids who are too small to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Chok Saveth Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Samraong village, Takeo province, a group of 11 people makes up the village bank loan group. The group members will use the loan to improve their families' living conditions. Mrs. Chok S. has been selected by the other members as the village bank president. 

She is a door-to-door Khmer cheese and fish sauce seller, earning some profit to support her family. Her husband is a farmer who owns a more than 2-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support the family and he is a cow middleman. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. 

To improve her daily income, Mrs. Chok S. is asking for a loan to buy more Khmer cheese to sell and use the rest of the loan to buy a cow to resell. She has two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local public school while the youngest one is 3 years old.

loans.use: To buy more Khmer cheese to sell

loans.name: Yonn

texts.en: Yonn C. is 27 years old, married, and has one child who attends the local public school. She and her husband are working in the same business as potato and salt traders.  They sell their products to their villagers and in other provinces for income. They use their old motor-trailer to pick up their items for sale.  On average, this couple earns $10.50 a day from this business, and it can support their family. Unfortunately, their motor-trailer broke down while they were working. Yonn C. wishes to buy another one, but her savings are not enough to make the purchase. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase a motor-trailer to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-trailer to replace the broken one

loans.name: Bolorzul

texts.en: Bolorzul E. is 33 years old, married and has two children, both of whom attend high school.  They live in Selenge province of Mongolia. She rents her house to people and lives in her mother's house, which is near her workplace. Her husband works as an assistant engine driver in the local train station.  Bolorzul operates a used consumer goods trading business in her town. She began her second-hand goods selling business in 2008 after operating a grocery shop in a rented space between 2005 and 2008. Over the years, she has established a permanent customer and supplier base and has gained a significant experience as a businesswoman. For the future, she hopes to continue to manage her business with stable operation and have her own workplace. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more used shoes to sell along with her used clothes.

loans.use: To purchase more used shoes

loans.name: Shaiyrbu's Group

texts.en:
Shaiyrbu M., 49, is the treasurer of this group. A widow residing in Tashkomur, a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan, she has a daughter and a son. Her son is married, while her 19-year-old daughter studies at the university in Osh.

In order to earn money, Shaiyrbubu works as a security guard, receiving a monthly salary of 4000 soms. She also breeds livestock animals to resell after fattening. Shaiyrbubu applied for this loan because she needs money to pay for her son’s military contract (that is, to pay money for passing the military training). In the future Shaiyrbubu wants to improve her living conditions and purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To pay for her son's military contract

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce, a member of Wema Vision group in Faulu Kenya, has been selling shoes for three years. With the income from her business, she is able to provide for her two children.  Now requesting her first loan of 50,000 Kes to buy more shoes and bags for her enterprise, Joyce hopes to open more business outlets in the future.

loans.use: To buy shoes and bags

loans.name: Chinara

texts.en:
Chinara S., a 42-year-old married mother of three children, lives with her family in Chat-Kul village. Her husband works as a railwayman.

In rural areas, where salaries are low and often unstable, it’s very hard to live, so in order to support her family and find an additional income, Chinara started her business in cattle breeding and beet cultivating, using her initial capital of 25,000 KGS. Owing to her persistent and hardworking personality, Chinara achieved success and used the revenues to pay for her elder daughter’s education.

Currently, Chinara’s farm consists of four milk cows and still needs to be developed. For this reason, she is applying for a loan of 60,000 KGS to buy more cattle. With the revenues from the loan, she plans to give a good education to her school-going children.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Erdenechuluun

texts.en:
Erdenechuluun P. is 38 years old and lives with her two children in an apartment in Hovd province, Mongolia. Both of her children attend a local school and her husband works and lives in Korea. Erdenechuluun operates a grocery trading business in her town. She sells a variety of food products out of her shop. She opened her grocery shop in 2005 after selling a variety of food products out of a container at the local market for several years. 

Erdenechuluun is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more grocery products to sell at her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
N. Milly is an individual client from Mubende. She is 30 years old and married with 3 children, 2 of them in school. Milly has a retail shop in Kyenda that has been in existence for 3 years. She is also involved in phone charging from her shop. 

Before her current businesses, Milly was a market vendor dealing in the sale of old shoes. She is able to make 400,000/= in weekly sales and her hard work and friendly nature have enabled her to succeed. Milly needs a loan to be able to complete her house since it has always been her dream to build her own house and educate her children.

loans.use: buying building materials to complete her house

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael is 43 years old and widowed with two children.  As the breadwinner in her family, she is able to raise her children with the income from her business where she sells second-hand clothes.  She has been operating the business for thirteen years and has managed to employ one person.  Her desire is to supply clothing wholesale in the future.  She has requested 50,000 Kes to buy shirts.

loans.use: To buy shirts

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: A. Andrew is an individual client from Rukungiri. He is 22 years old and married with 4 children and his business is dealing in agricultural products selling 'matooke' (green bananas) in the town. Andrew works closely with his wife and together, they are able to make 100,000/= as weekly profits. Andrew says that his customers are good and friendly and he needs a loan to be able to improve his banana plantation. Andrew says that this is a better business compared to the one he used to have, roasting meat by the roadside.

loans.use: Improving his banana plantation with fertilizers

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: K. Kate is an individual client from Rukungiri. She is 52 years old, very strong and hard-working with an agricultural business where she grows bananas in her banana plantation for sale. She is a salary earner and she has been in the agricultural business for 4 years. Kate is also involved in the sale of milk from her home in Kyagera cell. She works with her children since she is a widow and wants the best for all four of her children. Kate needs a loan to be able to improve her banana plantation by buying manure and fertilizers.

loans.use: Improving her banana plantation by buying manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
Lhagvasuren M. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Hovd province, Mongolia. He and his family all live together in their 'ger', a Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His older son attends a local secondary school and his younger is in kindergarten. His wife works in an ice cream making factory as a part-time worker. 

Lhagvasuren owns his own car and is a taxi driver in his town. He began his business in 2005 and has gained a lot of business experience over the years. His earnings have enabled him to improve his old car. For the future, he plans to buy a car for his wife who will also operate a taxi service in her free time to supplement their family income. Lhagvasuren is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a car in order to start another taxi service for his wife.

loans.use: To purchase a car in order to start another taxi service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying a plot of land for agriculture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more mobile phones to sell to his customers

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Mr. Prak H., age 60, is a father of two children, both of whom are single and help the family in its work. He is married to Mrs. Ny Pheap, who is 40 years old and works as a farmer on land they own behind their house. She and her husband grow rice and vegetables on this land, and are applying for a loan to reduce their transportation costs by buying a secondhand motorcycle that they will use to deliver goods to market and travel around their area.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand motorcycle for the family to use.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene S. lives in the village of Mapuroc, San Mateo. She is 38 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She makes a living by raising pigs, which she fattens before taking to market. She has been in this business for more than three years and earns about 4,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Irene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a loan for 5,000 PHP which which she will use to buy livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first issued to her by ASKI, and she plans to use it to continue expanding her business.  

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern parts of the country. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anjeline

texts.en: Anjeline is a businesswoman who operates a retail shop and a grocery.  She has been in this business for a decade, and hopes eventually to expand it to include a wholesale operation. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for helping her to become self-reliant, and has applied for a loan for 50,000 Kes to buy flour made of maize, beans, vegetables, sugar, wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.use: To buy flour, beans, vegetables, sugar, wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Oyunbat

texts.en: Oyunbat B. is 48 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She and her family have been living in their own house for the last 10 years. Her husband works as a teacher in a local school and Oyunbat operates a bakery where she sells a variety of pastries to people who live in her community. She started her own business in 2009 after working for others for many years. She is a hardworking, smart, very optimistic and hopes to expand her business further. To make this possible, she is applying for a loan for 600,000 MNT to buy more pastries and breads from a large bakery that sells its output to retail operations such as hers.

loans.use: To buy more pastries and breads from a wholesale company

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac C. is 34 years old and married to Caroline Kulei. They have been blessed with two children who are four years and three years old. Isaac supports four people including his brothers' child, his children and wife. His wife also supplements his income from her small grocery shop.

Isaac runs a carpentry workshop and has been in this business for almost 20 years. From this business, Isaac gets an average monthly income of Kshs 20,000.

He has borrowed his sixth loan of Kshs 40,000 from KADET LTD after successfully paying his previous loans on time. Isaac intends to use the Kshs 20,000 to purchase timber for his workshop and Kshs 20,000 to stock his new mini-hardware shop.

He plans to use his profits to expand his business and save for future use. His dream is to have a big workshop and be able to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase timber for his workshop

loans.name: Ceciliah

texts.en: Ceciliah is a 27-year-old single lady. She operates a salon so as to earn a living.  She has managed to employ three people in her business through Faulu Kenya.  She dreams of opening a hair-dressing school in the future.  She has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a hair dryer, hair blow dryer, foot massager, hair rollers, hair food and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy hair dryer, hair blow dryer, foot massager, hair rollers, hair food and cosmetics

loans.name: Munansi Development Group

texts.en: N. Florence is the leader of Munansi development group in Mubende. She is 34 years old and married with 3 children, all of them in school. Florence is a market vendor in Mubende, Kibaati zone where she sells clothes to retail buyers in the area. In addition, she is also involved in farming and as a result sells some of the produce from her farm. She was a tailor before the clothes business 10 years ago and she needs a loan to be able to buy more clothes for resale. She is a friendly lady and this has made her more successful.

loans.use: Purchasing more clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more fresh fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly N. born in 1978; she is a married woman and blessed with two children. Both of them are students in the local public school. She typically makes around $1.25 in profit each day to share responsibility with her husband who works as a firewood seller in and around the province of Kompong Tom, and makes a profit of around $4 per day. 

Ly N. has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn a living. Because selling animals is the core activity for making extra profit for her and her family, she wishes to buy two cows so that she can begin growing a small herd.

loans.use: To buy two cows  to begin growing a small herd

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 41-year-old married man, blessed with three children.  For a living, he does carpentry.  He has been engaged in the business for over eight years.  Besides carpentry, he farms so as to earn extra income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his financial status.  He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kes to buy timber.

loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Kigarama Kwetungura Group, Kihihi

texts.en: B. Benon belongs to Kigarama Kwetungura group. He is 78 years old and married with 4 children aged 13 – 7 years and deals in the sale of produce, mostly tea. He is able to make 80,000/= as weekly profits and these he believes will grow. He has been in the business for 30 years after inheriting it from his father and the biggest advantage he has is that he is near the factory where he sells the tea. He is hard-working and cooperative and he needs a loan to be able to buy more tea leaves for sale.

loans.use: Buying more tea leaves to sell to the factory

loans.name: Clarita's Group

texts.en:
Clarita G. is from the village of Libertad Echague. She is 47 years old. Clarita is the group leader of an 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Clarita G..

Clarita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Clarita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling fruits and vegetables. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling fruit and vegetables to local community members. Clarita has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Clarita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clarita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Clarita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Clarita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the PhilippI.. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nouth

texts.en:
Mrs. Nouth N. is a 37-year-old farmer residing in a rural area of Kompong Tom Province. She feeds some pigs in a pigpen behind her house. Eventually, she will sell her pigs to a slaughterer in four-month cycles. Her husband works cutting firewood, and he has owns a rice hulling machine inside his home for providing rice milling services to his neighbors for extra income. 

This couple has two kids, still living with them till present. Usually Mrs. Nouth N. generates around US$3 of profit a day to meet the needs of her family. In order to earn more income, Mrs. Nouth N. will be using the loan to buy more pig feed and piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy more pig feed and piglets to raise

loans.name: Lubugumu Twekembe-Mukono Group

texts.en:
42-year-old, affable B. Florence operates a pharmacy in Namayuba-Mukono. This business has been in existence for a decade now. Her experience, training and later employment as a nurse have been instrumental in the smooth running and overseeing of operations at her pharmacy. From the point of view of the right prescription of drugs for  patients and advice, she has been up to the mark. 

The aforementioned combined with diligence, proper planning and her good-natured personal qualities have been her stars and stripes. Florence, who is single but with 5 kids, says weekly this business generates her  300,000 shillings. Florence carries the conviction that with this loan, her financial prospects will continue to get better. With this loan, she says she is going to expand her business.

loans.use: The expansion of her pharmacy business

loans.name: Felistar

texts.en: Felistar is a single mother of two. To raise her family, she runs a salon.  She started the business in 2007 and has been able to grow the business through Faulu Kenya.  This is because of financial support from Faulu Kenya.  Her business is located in the slums and she hopes to move the business into the City Centre in the future.  She has requested 30,000 Kes to buy hair braids, weaves, hair oil and hair chemicals.

loans.use: To buy hair braids, weaves, hair oil and hair chemicals

loans.name: Kiruuma Twekambe Group

texts.en: S. Levicato is a 46-year-old farmer who makes a living selling produce such as beans and maize in his town of Kiruuma. He also leads the Kiruuma Twekambe group and is raising three children. He has been in this business for more than 20 years and is doing well by buying produce from local farmers and selling it to local traders. His dreams are to buy a car to use in his business, and to continue paying his children's school fees so they can have a good education and succeed in life.

loans.use: To buy beans and maize to resell to local traders.

loans.name: Kov

texts.en: Kov C., 52 years old, owns a small shop located beside a road where she sells soft drinks and palm juice produced by her husband, who is very skilled at climbing the palm trees located right behind their house. On a typical day, she earns about $1.50 in profit. She and her husband have four children, two of whom are married. She is doing well because she provides good customer service, and is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers and to buy a ladder for her husband because this will make it much easier for him to climb palm trees.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks to sell to her customers, and a ladder for her husband to use when climbing palm trees.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip K. is 62 years old, married and supports a family of eight. His wife has no income so he is the sole provider. Phillip runs a retail shop in Kapsoo Trading Centre 10 km from Kabarnet town. From this business, he gets a monthly profit of Kshs 4,000.

Phillip has borrowed a loan of Kshs 10,000 and he intends to use the entire amount to restock his business. He also anticipates using the profits to expand his business. His dream and hope is to open a wholesale shop and buy land for his family.

loans.use: To add more stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying soda, sugar and rice to sell to his customers

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 31-year-old married man with three children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. For the last 10 years he has made a living by running a barber shop. He started with one station and has since expanded to three. Despite this expansion, he does not have enough stations and equipment to serve his customers. He would very much like to expand his business so that he can earn enough money to provide his children with an excellent education, and will use this loan to make that expansion possible.

loans.use: To expand a barber shop

loans.name: 02-  Mật Sơn 2- Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Thanh C. Thị (04) is a 57-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Thanh is the leader of a seven-member group loan offered by Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02- Mật Sơn 2- Đông Vệ (08.09.02 Đông Vệ ).
Thanh is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Thanh owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling to local businesses and community members.  Thanh has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND per month from these activities.
In 2010, Thanh joined Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thanh is requesting her first loan from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. She is requesting a loan of 4,248,000 VND, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Thanh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group
1.  N. Thị Thơ (05) is a 48-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.
2.  L. Thị Huệ (06) is a 59-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a manufacturing business.
3.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Seag

texts.en: Seag H. is married and has four children, three of whom live with the family.  He is a hard-working man who has been earning an income by picking up firewood in and around the province of Kompong Tom. Usually, he can get a profit of approximately $2.10 a day, which he uses to support his family. His wife is a local farmer and she also feeds a few people behind her house for additional revenue. Seag H.’s wife is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for her planting her crop; however, she does not have capital to use on her farm. Seag H. is requesting a loan to use for his wife to purchase fertilizers, a pump machine, and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, a pump machine, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Debora

texts.en: Debora is a thirty-two-year-old married female with four children and owns a house in Kasese. She has been operating a retail shop for ten years during  which she initially was selling produce in the market but saved money to start a retail shop. Her challenges are debtors and price fluctuation of goods and her vision is to sell wholesale and educate her children. Debora intends to use the loan to buy rice for sale in her shop.

loans.use: To buy rice for sale in her shop

loans.name: Pacita's Group

texts.en:
Pacita R. is from the village of Divisoria Santiago. She is 55 years old. Pacita is the group leader of an 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Pacita R..

Pacita is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Pacita owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Pacita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Pacita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pacita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Pacita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Pacita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is a forty-four-year-old widow and owns a semi-permanent house in Kasese. She has been selling paint and scrap materials for four years and rents a room to sell the products in. The hardship is buying scrap which is stolen. Her vision is to educate her children to higher institutions of learning.

Scovia intends to use the loan to buy scrap and paint for sale.

loans.use: To buy paint and scrap

loans.name: Lizy Kemuma

texts.en:
Lizy Kemuma is a 25-year-old enterprising lady in Kisumu city. She is married to Kennedy Okile who runs a shoe-selling business in the same town. They have a three-year-old daughter Marlene who is in nursery school.

Lizy runs a boutique in the heart of Kisumu city and has been doing this for the last three years with great success. She makes a monthly income of Kshs 10,000. She joined Kadet Ltd when the need for micro credit arose and she took a first loan, which she paid without default. She is now taking a second loan of Kshs 40,000, which she will use to buy clothes and shoes for sale. She prefers ladies shoes because of their high demand in the town of Kisumu and she normally gets her stock from the capital city of Kenya, Nairobi.

She will use the profits to educate her daughter Marlene because she believes this is the best she can give her as a parent. Her dream is to one day open a very big boutique in town where she can supply clothes at a wholesale price.

loans.use: To buy shoes and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Joshua Maina

texts.en:
Joshua has been practicing farming in Naivasha town for the last three years. He is 38 years old and married to Loise Waithira. They have two school age children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of 10,000 KES in full and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount for land preparation and for buying seedlings for planting.  In the future, he hopes to practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: Preparation of land and to buy seedlings

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 34 years old, married with two children.  She sells second-hand clothes so as to earn a living.  She has been running the business for ten years and has grown it through financial support from Faulu Kenya.  Apart from selling second-hand clothes, she does poultry farming to supplement her income.  She hopes to expand her business into wholesale in the future.
