She, however, faces the challenge of price fluctuations, which affect her cash flows. She hopes to have as many cows as possible in the near future. She hopes that with Juhudi loans, she will be able to expand her dairy farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida N. lives in the Kawala neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children all of whom are in school. Farida has a retail business selling second-hand clothing at the market. She has had this business for eight years, and works seven days a week. She also generates additional income through a restaurant where she employs two girls. 

The main business challenges for Farida are transportation and seasonality. Her goals for her business are to start selling wholesale only, and also to build her own house. Farida lives in a home that she rents with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food, and rent

loans.use: TO buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Mulandi

texts.en:
Mulandi is 38 years old and married to Mwikali. They have two school-going children. Mulandi owns a phone accessories shop. He has been running it for 15 years with an income of about Kshs. 3,000 per month. 

This is his fourth loan after repaying the previous one successfully. He intends to use the loan to buy a generator and phone accessories. He hopes to be a supplier of phone accessories.

loans.use: To buy a generator and phone accessories

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en: Leonard is a 45-year-old businessman who is married with one child aged 17 years. He has owned rental houses for the last three years. He plans to use the loan to build more iron sheet houses to rent. He is more likely to succeed because Uthiru and Kangemi are low-income areas and most houses are built of iron sheets, making them affordable to the residents there. He was introduced to Kadet by a group and this is his first loan. He plans to use the anticipated profits to buy extra land and build more rental houses.

loans.use: To build rental houses.

loans.name: Sania

texts.en: Sania N. lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. Sania has a business selling second-hand clothing. She has had this business for eight years, and works seven days a week. Sania sells her products retail at the market.  She has requested a loan of 400000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. Her main business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goals are to start selling wholesale only, and also to build her own house. Sania lives in a home that she rents with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Newton

texts.en: Newton S. K. is thirty two years old, married to a business lady. They have one child, aged six, who they hope to educate to university level. His business is located at Kinanie and he is served by the Kitengela Branch. He has been selling keg beer and soft drinks to local men, both young and elderly, for eight years. He has had his business for three years and has one employee. Newton says that his business is profitable and his major challenge is harrasment by the local administration who want a bribe to allow him to continue selling beer. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more beverages to meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business, buy a plot of land, and build a house to live in. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: Beverages

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is an ambitious married man with a child, who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He dreams of educating his children so that they can have a better future and he is building a permanent house. He buys and resells shoes and the business is very profitable. Joseph requires the loan to buy shoes for selling.

loans.use: Buying shoes for resale

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha N. lives in the Nabulagala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  Aisha has a business of charcoal selling. She has been in this business for five years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Aisha sells her products at the market, by means of retail.    

Aisha has requested for a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through vending cooked food. The main business challenge(s) for Aisha include transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van, to start selling only by wholesale and also to build her own house. Aisha lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has been in the farming business for over twenty years now. Her farm, located in Murang'a town in central Kenya, produces maize and beans which she sells locally. Farming has been her main source of income. 

She has requested a loan of 53,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the extra income from the sale of milk will increase the income for her household. This income will help her take care of her grandchildren whom she lives with. Her main challenge in farming has been the lack of a stable market for milk. In five years time, she hopes to have ventured fully into dairy farming and own at least four high yielding dairy cows.

Esther is 54 years old and married with six adult children. She comments that the future is bright for her and she is happy that she can start her project with the help of Juhudi's financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia N. lives in the makerere Kikoni neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4children and all her children go to school, She also takes care of additional family members (a sister and a brother). Sophia has a business of a restaurant. She has been in this business for seven years, and she works seven days out of every week. Sophia sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  

Sophia has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more food items such as bunches of bananas, beef, and charcoal, sweet and Irish potatoes. She also generates additional income through her retail shop. The main business challenge(s) for Sophia include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked hotel and also to run three more restaurants in Kikoni. Sophia lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but doesn’t have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes, beef and charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, meat, fish, cooking oil, onion, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON DE SANTIAGO”; El banco está ubicado
en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Clorinda; ella tiene 32 años de edad, soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia
alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de peluches, la socia viaja hasta
desaguadero (frontera con Bolivia) para comprar mercadería para su negocio y luego lo
lleva hasta la provincia de Abancay donde ella lo vende a sus clientes.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para su negocio.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se
compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Clorinda is a member of the “Patron de Santiago” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Clorinda is 32 years old.  She is single and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling cuddly toys.  She travels to Desaguadero (on the Bolivian border) to buy merchandise for her business and then brings it back to Abancay province where she sells it to her customers.

Clorinda is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for her business.  She is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and cuddly toys

loans.name: Avetik

texts.en:
Avetik A. is 54 years old and he lives in Ijevan city with his wife and his school aged son. 

In 2007, Avetik and his wife organized their own bakery which they have managed to the present time. At the same time Avetik runs a food shop, where he sells part of his bakery’s production. The remaining part of his bakery’s production is delivered to other food shops. 

Thanks to their hard work, Avetik and his wife were able to buy a car, which makes their work much easier. Now they can transport their bakery’s production and shop’s merchandise without excess expenses. 

Avetik asks for a 500.000 AMD loan to buy flour for his bakery and to increase his shop’s assortment. Avetik received a loan from Nor Horizon four times already without delays in payment.

loans.use: To buy flour for his bakery and to increase his shop’s assortment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a 34-year-old lady, married and a mother of three children aged 15,13 and three years old. She has been selling ornaments through moving around Nairobi city and surrounding estates for the last two years where she manages to get a profit of Kshs 8,000 monthly.

She was introduced to Kadet by  a friend who has benefited and this is her first loan. She plans to buy more ornaments for sale. She plans to be in the position of importing ornaments in bulk from Dubai in future.

loans.use: Ornaments for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy bags of flour and sugar

loans.name: Hayat

texts.ar:
حياة في عمر 56 سنة تعمل في محل لبيع الالعاب والهدايا لها في عملها 9 سنوات متزوجة
ولها ولد تحب عملها وتطمح ان تفتتح محل اكبر لكي تتوسع به طموحة  لا تريد ان يعيقها المادة في مجال عملها
تتلقى الدعم من عائلتها وهي تريد من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة الى شراء العاب وهدايا جديدة بمناسبة
الاعياد تاريخها مع المجموعة جيد وميز حيث كانت تتلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة
texts.en: Hayat is a 56-year-old wife and mother who has been working in a toy store for the past nine years. She is very ardent about her business, which she wants to expand by relocating to a larger shop. Hayat, who enjoys a distinguished credit history with Al Majmoua, is now seeking a loan to purchase games and other presents for the upcoming holidays.

loans.use: Purchase games and other presents for toy store

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old. He is married and the provider for three children.

In 2007 Hassan opened his own food market since there is high demand in his local area. Now he is becoming well-known and has an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a refrigerator, renovate and install roll shutters for the shop. He is aiming to grow bigger and extend the shop to increase his revenue.

loans.use: Buy a refrigerator, renovate and install roll shutters for the shop

loans.name: Alain

texts.ar:
الن عمره 33 سنة متزوج وله ولد الن يعمل في بيع وتصليح الخليوي يحب عمله وله فيه اكثر من سنتين يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء هواتف خليوي جديدة للمحل يريد ان يطور نفسه وعائلته فهو طموح  ويسعى دائما الى تحسين وضعه المادي والاجتماعي ولكنه يعاني صعوبة في المنافسة فهو يريد زيادة رأس المال
لكي يحسن وضعه
texts.en: Alain is a 33-year-old husband and father who is determined to advance himself and his family. For the past two years, he has been selling and repairing cell phones. Alain is very industrious and constantly strives to improve his financial situation. Nevertheless, he is in need of more capital to overcome the stiff competition, and accordingly would like to request a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase new cellular phones for his store.

loans.use: Purchase new cell phones for retail

loans.name: Kasem

texts.en: Kasem is a 36-year-old man from Nabatieh. He has worked in construction for the past ten years. He is requesting a loan from A. majmoua to buy materials for his business specializing in cement. He will also use a portion of the loan to pay for some of his wedding expenses. Kasem is a man of honor: he is honest and hard-working in the eyes of his neighbors, clients, and relatives. He hopes to expand his business and build his dream house in the future.

loans.use: To buy materials for cement business

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON DE SANTIAGO”; El banco está ubicado
en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Adela; ella tiene 33 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La
socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de verdura y
fruta siendo el mercado de Huancaro donde ella distribuye su mercadería y al público
en general, la socia también distribuye a una ONG URPIWASI ya lleva tiempo en este
negocio.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más insumos para su negocio.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se
compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Adela belongs to the “Patron de Santiago” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Adela is 33 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business buying and selling fruit and vegetables.  She sells her produce in Huancaro market, to the general public.  She also supplies her produce to a low-cost, low-income, children's day care center.  She has been in this business for some time.

Adela is requesting her loan to buy more supplies for her business.  She is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business (fruit and vegetables)

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith W. is 33 years old, single, and has no children. Her business is located at the Nairobi Central Business District. She sells clothes such as jeans, women's suits, blouses, and shoes. Her clients include both men and women. She says that this business is profitable. Her only major challenge is that the business is seasonal, so sometimes her business is slower and she makes less profit. However, she works very hard every day from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 50,000 KES to buy more clothes in preparation for the Christmas holiday. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and open more outlets while importing the clothes. She describes herself as a very hard-working lady.

loans.use: To purchase inventory of clothing

loans.name: Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “SARTASIÑANI” está ingresando a su Noveno ciclo en el Centro Focal de Senkata. Cuenta con doce integrantes, once mujeres y un varón.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta, la señora María, por la tesorera, la señora Luperta y como secretaria de actas Maria del Rosario. Los negocios de las señoras están relacionados con el comercio y servicio, como por ejemplo: venta de dulces, comercio  y costura de buzos, artesanías, tienda de barrio, venta de refresco, sastrería, venta de plásticos, venta de comida, venta de golosinas.

La señora María, presidenta de la asociación “Sartasiñani”, fue fundadora de la banca comunal “Sartasiñani”. A la fecha cuenta con dos negocios, uno requiere que  salga del hogar y vaya por las ferias de manera ambulante, vendiendo productos de limpieza personal, como jaboncillo, shampoo, esponja, y otros.  El otro negocio es la elaboración de zapatitos para muñecas “Barbie”, que vende por mayor a sus clientes, quienes venden en las ciudades donde se cuenta con la Feria de las Alasitas (Festividad en la que se vende miniaturas, de todo lo que las personas utilizan, inclusive inmuebles y terrenos)

La señora María es viuda desde hace 16 años tiempo en el que tuvo que velar sola por sus siete hijos.
Cuando le consultan sobre  qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que "su grupo", el estar juntas. 

En la foto, en la esquina superior izquierda, está la señora Luperta.
texts.en:
The SARTASIÑANI community bank is beginning its ninth loan cycle in the Sentaka regional office.  The bank has twelve members: eleven women and one man.  The bank's board is made up of the president, María, the treasurer, Luperta and the secretary, María del Rosario.  The ladies' businesses are in commerce and services.  They include: sweet sales, making and selling tracksuits, handicrafts, neighborhood store, soft drink sales, tailoring, plastic sales, food sales, candy sales.

María, president of the Sartasiñani association, was the founder of the Sartasiñani community bank..  She currently has two businesses.  Her first business requires her to leave her home and work in the markets as a street trader, selling toiletries such as bars of soap, shampoo, sponges, etc.  Her other business is making little shoes for Barbie dolls.  She sells these to her customers wholesale.  Her customers then sell them in the cities which host 'la Feria de las Alasitas' (a market where they sell miniatures of everything that people use, including furniture and land).

María has been a widow for 16 years during which time she has had to look out for her seven children on her own.  When we asked her what she likes most about Pro Mujer, she replied that it was being part of her group and being together.

In the photo, in the top left-hand corner, is Luperta (whose face is not visible in the original group photo).

loans.use: To buy bars of soap, shampoo and material for making miniatures

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more phone cards to resell

loans.name: Joshua Musyoki

texts.en:
Joshua is 42 years old and married to Sarah; they have two children. Joshua has been a maize farmer for a period of two years with an income of about Kshs. 5,000 per month.  

This is his first loan with KADET which he wants to use to buy maize and beans seeds for his farm for the next planting season. He hopes to buy a piece of land and build his residential house in the future.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans seeds for his farm

loans.name: Kipkirui

texts.en:
Thirty-four-year-old Kipkirui is a dairy farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley Kenya. He is married with one child, age 10, who attends school. He has been farming for the last ten years and sells his milk through Cherobu dairy plant in Litein town. He also earns income from his small-scale farming of tea which he sells locally.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo in the amount of 70,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow and expand his poultry farm. The extra income from the sale of milk and eggs will help him meet the needs of his family. He says that his major challenge has been lack of enough storage facilities for animal feed. He hopes that he will be selling at least 30 litres of milk daily in the near future. He is also requesting Juhudi to hold trainings especially on poultry and dairy feeds.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow and expand his poultry farm

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON DE SANTIAGO”; El banco está ubicado
en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Alejandro; el tiene 39 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; el socio
alterna sus actividades diarias con el servicio de taxi el trabaja todos los días siendo
su horario desde las 06am hasta las 07:00pm y otras veces más tarde, esta es la única
actividad que realiza por el momento y es de esta manera saca a su familia adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la terminar de construir su casa.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se
compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Alejandro belongs to the “Patron de Santiago” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Alejandro is 39 years old.  He is married and has 2 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his taxi service.  He works every day from 6.00am to 7.00pm.  Sometimes he works later.  This is the only business activity that he has at the moment and it is how he gets his family ahead.

Alejandro is requesting this loan so that he can finish building his house.  He is grateful to those who will take part in his dream by funding his loan and pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy materials to finish building his house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes to resell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 51 years old and married to Francis, who does mixed farming (that is, both crop and dairy farming).  They have six children.  Jane has been a farmer for the last 10 years.
She has never borrowed from any other MFI, and she will use this loan to buy a cow to boost the dairy farming activity.
The fact that she was able to repay her previous two loans with Kadet indicates that she is doing well in the business which earns her Ksh 10,000 monthly.  She plans to use the anticipated profits to support her children's education.

loans.use: Buying  a dairy cow

loans.name: Zaid

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 21 years old. He lives with four family members.

In 2008, Zaid opened his own workshop where he manufactures metal water tanks. His becoming well-known in his local community and has an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a $1200 loan to buy two specialized machines for his business. His goal is to produce more water tanks and expand into making new products so he will be able to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: Buy two specialized machines

loans.name: Celestin

texts.fr: Célestin M. est commerçant.  Il est célibataire, et son niveau d’éducation est l’année 7eme.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter les œufs et les vendre.  Son stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargner, est la diversification des produits.  Il voudrait l’augmentation ou la capacité d’accueillir beaucoup de clients.  Il voudrait aussi se marier dans l’avenir.
texts.en: Célestin M. is a merchant.  He is single and has had seven years of schooling.  He is going to use his loan to buy eggs to sell.  His strategy for growth is to increase his savings and to diversify his products. He would like to attract a larger clientele.  He also hopes to marry in the future.

loans.use: to buy and resell eggs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more building materials

loans.name: Frank Howard

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON DE SANTIAGO”; El banco está ubicado
en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Frank; el tiene 24 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; el socio
alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes el cual se encuentra
ubicado en su casa, el socio a la vez es estudiante universitario de la carrera de turismo
en la Universidad particular Andina del Cusco, el socio desea terminar de una vez su
carrera y así tener otro ingreso para poder vivir mejor.

El socio solicita el préstamo para los viajes que realiza con su carrera universitaria y
también para su uso personal.
texts.en:
Frank belongs to the “Patron de Santiago” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Frank is 24 years old.  He is single and has one child.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his grocery store business which is located in his home.  He is also a university student and is studying tourism at the Universidad Particular Andina del Cusco.  He would like to finish his studies and thereby have another source of income so that he can live more comfortably.

Frank is requesting this loan for the trips that he makes as part of his university course and also for personal use.

loans.use: To pay for the trips that he makes as part of his university course and for personal use

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON DE SANTIAGO”; El banco está ubicado
en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nélida; ella tiene 52 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia
alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de sabanas, colchas, cobertores
entre otros más, la socia tiene su stand en el centro comercial El Molino la cual trabaja
conjuntamente con su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su negocio.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se
compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nélida belongs to the “Patron de Santiago” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Nélida is 52 years old.  She is married and has 4 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling sheets, bedspreads, quilts, etc.  She has a stand in the El Molino shopping mall and she works there together with her family.

Nélida is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for her business.  She is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (sheets, bedspreads, quilts)

loans.name: Yihia

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 39 years old. He is married and has two children.

In 2008, Yihia opened his own food market. He has a wide variety of food products. He's becoming well-known in his local area and has an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to renovate his shop and to buy a small generator. In the area where he lives, the electricity supply is unreliable, so if he has a generator he will be able to stay open longer in the evenings.   His goal is to increase his revenue and expand his business in the future.

loans.use: Renovate his shop and to buy a small generator

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul operates Star Autospare shop, where he sells spare parts for vehicles.  He has been running this business for six years and employs three people.  Paul was able to open the business because he had gained some skills by working in another auto parts shop.  As a member of Faulu Kenya, he is able to save his money.  

He hopes to expand his shop in the future.  He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy starters, distributors and alternators.

loans.use: To buy starters, distributors and alternators.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is a farmer in Murang'a town, central Kenya where he has been farming for five years. He is also a business man since his farm produces maize and beans that he sells locally. He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 53,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help improve the livelihood of his family. He says that pure breed dairy cows are expensive to buy and it takes time to breed one. He hopes to acquire a pure-bred cow, producing over 30 litres of milk daily. Bernard is 33 years old and married with one child, aged 3.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.es: Cresencia C. D. T. D. 55 años D. edad, resiD. en Ilobasco, ubicado en el departamento D. Cabañas. Ella vive junto a su esposo y un hijo. Cresencia posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, un negocio muy estable, ya que no cuenta con mucha competencia y así mismo tiene muchos años D. dedicarse a este trabajo por lo que es muy conocida en el lugar. Cresencia solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en nuevos productos para la tienda como: nuevas golosinas, bebidas, y así mismo aumentar la cantidad D. productos principales los cuales poseen mayor cantidad D. demanda como: pan, leche, huevos y detergentes. Ella es una madre D. familia muy responsable la cual desea mejorar su estabilidad económica y poder vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Crescencia C. D. T. is 55 years old.  She lives in Ilobasco, in Cabañas department.  She lives with her husband and child.  Crescencia has a store where she sells perishable goods.  It is a very stable business since she doesn't have a lot of competition and she has been in the business for a lot of years which means that she is very well known in her town.

Crescencia is requesting a loan from Integral so that she can have the money she needs to invest in buying new products for her store such as: new candy and drinks.  She would also like to be able to increase the quantity of the main products she sells that are in most demand such as: bread, milk, eggs and detergents.  Crescencia is a very responsible mother who would like to improve her financial stability and be able to live more comfortably.

loans.use: To buy food products to sell

loans.name: Annonciata

texts.fr: Annonciata N. est commerçante. Elle a 38 ans, elle est mariée, et elle a 4 enfants entre 2 ans et 8 ans.  Elle a une éducation primaire, et 3 de ses enfants vont a l’école.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter les pommes de terre pour les vendre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargner, et augmenter les clients.  Elle voudrait avoir ses enfants terminer les études, et acheter une parcelle.  Apres avoir acheté la parcelle, elle prendra un prêt pour construire leur propre maison.
texts.en: Annonciata N. is a merchant.  She is 38 years old, married, and has four children between two and eight years of age. She has a primary education, and three of her children attend school.  She is going to use her loan to buy potatoes to sell.  Her strategy for growth is to economize and to increase her client base. She would like to see her children complete their schooling, and she would like to buy a plot of land.  Once she has bought her plot of land, she will take out a loan for building a house of their own.

loans.use: to buy and resell potatoes

loans.name: Rebecca Awino

texts.en: For the last year Rebecca has been a fishmonger in Naivasha town. She is 35 years old married to Christopher Ondiko. They have three children. She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend. This will be her first loan with which she plans to buy  a refrigerator for storing fish. In the future, Rebecca  hopes to be able to supply fish in large quantity to various markets and hotels  beyond Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy  a refrigerator for storing fish.

loans.name: Nathem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old and a married man.

In 2007, Nathem decided to open his own mini-market. Although his shop is small, he is well-known in his local community and has a good reputation.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to install a canopy outside his shop and buy a refrigerator to allow him to sell frozen meat. He is aiming to extend his store and grow his business.

loans.use: Install a canopy outside his shop and buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Concepción De La Paz

texts.es: Concepción de la Paz C. A. de 41 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador, junto a su familia la cual esta conformada por su esposo y un hijo quien se dedica a estudiar. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, la cual se esfuerza mucho para poder aportar a su hogar y así contar con una vida mejor. Concepción posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad, así mismo cuenta con una librería. Ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder surtir la tienda y así mismo surtir la librería con todo lo necesario como: papelería, cuadernos, colores y todo lo más esencial para aprovechar la venta de inicio de año cuando se da la temporada de inicio de clases, así de esta forma ella podrá mejorar sus ventas brindando un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: Concepción de la Paz C. A. is 41 years old and lives in San Salvador department with her family: her husband and a son who is studying.  She is a very hard-working and responsible woman who works hard so that she can support her household and thereby enjoy a better life.  Concepción owns a store in which she sells essentials.  She also has a book store.  She is requesting this loan so that she can stock her general store and also stock her book store with everything she needs such as: stationery, exercise books, colored pencils and other essential items so that she can take advantage of the beginning of the year which is the back-to-school period.  In this way she will be able to improve her sales, providing a better service to her customers.

loans.use: To buy essentials to stock her general store and her book store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rock and oil to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: 14 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “14 de Diciembre”está ingresando a su Tercer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación. Cuenta con ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un varón.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta, la señora Rosa, por la tesorera, la señora Noly y como secretario de actas, el señor David. Los negocios de las señoras están relacionados con el comercio y servicio, como por ejemplo: venta de frutas, venta de carcasas de celular, joyas, pasanaco, tienda de abarrotes, transportista, venta de chompas y corbatas.

La señora Betzabe, presidenta de la asociación “14 de Diciembre”, ya tiene experiencia de tres ciclos como socia en Pro Mujer,  su negocio es la venta en una tienda de abarrotes.  Antes su negocio era viajar trayendo mercadería, pero con el tiempo ese negocio resultó ser muy pesado y aconsejada por sus hija decidió abrir la tienda.  Esta tienda es atendida de 8 de la mañana a 4 de la tarde  por la señora Betzabe y sus hijos.
Cuando le consultan sobre  qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que su grupo y el estar juntas.
texts.en:
The '14 de Diciembre' (14th of December) community bank is entering its third loan cycle in the Villa Exaltación regional office.  The bank has eight members: seven women and one man.  The bank's board is made up of the president, Rosa, the treasurer, Noly and the secretary, David.  The members' businesses are in commerce and services.  They include: fruit sales, cell phone case sales, jewelry, 'pasanaco' (a group savings fund), grocery store, taxi driver, and sweater and tie sales.

Betzabe is president of the '14 de Diciembre' association.  She has experience as a member of Pro Mujer, having been through three loan cycles.  Her business is running a grocery store.  Her business used to be travelling and buying merchandise but over time this business became very difficult and, on her daughter's advice, she decided to open a store.  She serves in her store from 8.00am to 4.00pm together with her children.

When we asked Betzabe what she liked most about Pro Mujer she replied that it was her group and being together.

loans.use: To buy food products: rice, noodles, sugar and oil

loans.name: Ihsan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old. He lives with six family members. 

In 2006, Ihsan opened his own barber shop after having a long experience in helping his dad who has a similar business. He is becoming well-known and has a good reputation in his local area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to decorate his store, buy a small generator and new shaving tools. He is aiming to grow his business to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: Decorate his store, buy a small generator and new shaving tools

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 37 years old and married with two children. To earn a living, he sells spare parts for vehicles. He has seven years of experience in this business. He also works as an electrician to earn extra income. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his money and has been empowered to work hard in his business. He dreams of growing the business so that he may be self-reliant. He has requested 50,000 KES to buy distributors, alternators, and a winding machine.

loans.use: To buy distributors, alternators, and a winding machine.

loans.name: La Fe 1, 2, 4 Group

texts.en:
Marie is the coordinator of her group La Fe 1,2,4 (The Faith). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. She says that her most difficult challenges are to educate her children and to support all of their needs. She sells clothing and accessories, a business she enjoys doing. 

Marie is excited to be taking out her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She has had her business for two years. She plans to use this loan to purchase blue jeans and women's shoes. She will use the profits to buy some clothes for her children for Christmas and to invest in her business. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because of "the respect that Esperanza offered to us and the type of program that we receive." Her story is representative of her group and, generally, of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominates the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and shoes

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia de 57 años,   ha sido una madre soltera desde hace muchos años atrás por eso  ha mantenido el hogar hasta que sus hijos crecieran.  Para dales una mejor vida a sus hijos y asegurar su futura vejez ella readecuo su casa ubicando una pequeña tienda en la entrada de su casa. 

Ella tiene la tienda desde que se separo de su esposo para poder conseguir sus propios ingresos, comenzó comprando enlatados, granos, dulces a un precio económico. Por vivir en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso y conocido porque es una de las zona marginales de Guayaquil pudo valerse de esa oportunidad y comenzar a vender con un mayor volumen su mercadería. 

Para poder incrementar su mercadería ella quiere comprar con el préstamo bebidas, lácteos, enlatados. En el futuro quiere ampliar y surtir más su tienda para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Natalia, age 57, has been a single mother for many years.  Therefore, she has maintained her home until her children are grown.  In order to give her children a better life and to insure her old age in the future, she fixed up her house by placing a small store at the entrance.

She has had the store since she separated from her husband.  She has the store in order to get her own income.  She started by purchasing canned goods, grains, and sweets at an economical price.  She lives in a periurban zone called Paraíso.  It is known as one of the marginal zones in Guayaquil.  She was able to make use of this opportunity, and she started selling her merchandise in greater quantities.

In order to be able to increase her merchandise, she wants to use the loan to buy drinks, dairy products, and canned goods.  In the future she wants to expand and stock her store more.  She wants to do this in order to give her children a better future.

loans.use: Canned goods and grains

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah N. K. is a married lady. Her husband is an accountant. They have three children, ages 6 to 19, that they hope to educate to the university level. Her business, Princess Exhibition, is located in the Nairobi Central Business District and is well known. She sells clothes such as blouses, suits, handbags, and shoes. Her clients include both men and women who walk in. She also has repeat customers. She says that this business is profitable. Her only major challenge is that the business is seasonal, which means that sometimes business is slow and profits are fewer. However, she works very hard every day from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 50,000 KES to buy more clothes in preparation for the Christmas holiday. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and own a boutique. She describes herself as patient and visionary.

loans.use: To purchase clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow and expand her poultry farm.

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old and married.

In 2009, Firas decided to open his own store selling electrical devices. He is well experienced since he used to work in this field before. Now he is becoming well-known in his area and has an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a $3000 loan increase his inventory, advertise, and install more shelves in his store. He is aiming to grow bigger in the future and expand his work.

loans.use: Increase his inventory, advertise, and install more shelves in his store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more wood

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret W. lives in the Kamwokya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 3 children, all of whom are in school.  She lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.   

Margaret has been in the tailoring business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days a week. She sells her products from home, by means of retail.    She has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of cloth. The main business challenges for Margaret include the rainy season and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations are to have her own tailoring school and to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow and expand her poultry project.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian de 47 años, nunca se caso pero si tuvo un hijo que en la actualidad es mayor de edad y desde hace muchos años se fue a vivir a España para conseguir una estabilidad económica y poderle ayudar a su madre. Para tener una actividad económica y no quedarse sola ella acepto la propuesta que le hizo una amiga en donde ella seria vendedora de productos Yanbal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes). 

En la actualidad realiza su trabajo sola. Trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes, cremas, desodorantes a un valor muy económico. Ella tiene pensado seguir trabajando para asegurar su vejez. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yanbal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere una actividad económica que no tenga que caminar mucho, por eso quiere tener una papelería.
texts.en:
Lilian is 47 years old.  She never married, but she did have a child.  Her child is grown, and he went to live in Spain many years ago.  He went to get financial security and to be able to help his mother.

In order to have a financial activity and to not be alone, she accepted the proposal that a friend made.  She would sell Yanbal (business that offers enterprising women a start with independent sales) products.  She currently works alone.  She starts work very early by offering her products to her friends and neighbors.  She sells perfume, creams, and deodorants at a very economical price.  She is planning to continue working in order to secure her old age.

She wants to use the loan to buy Yanbal products like perfumes, creams, and deodorants.  In the future she would like to have a business activity where she does not have to walk a lot.  That is why she wants to have a stationery store.

loans.use: Creams and perfumes

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 48 years old, married, and has five children.  She has been practicing dairy farming for six years.  Most of her customers are people from her area.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business.  She is hoping to start large-scale farming in the future.  She has requested 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Tatimalap Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are 3 small businesswomen in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to seek a loan of SLL 1,400,000 for each, to enable them expand their businesses.  

With a loan of SLL 1,400,000, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales, and create more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school, and to feed and clothe them. 

Fatu K. is the leader of this group. She was born in a village call Gbendembu Ngowahun, in northern Sierra Leone about sixty-five years ago. She is married and has ten children. 

Fatu sells firewood.  She has been running this business for ten years.  She is requesting this loan in order to purchase piles of firewood from the neighboring villages to sell.

loans.use: To buy firewood to sell

loans.name: Flamingo Group

texts.en: Alex K. (pictured at the right) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born forty-eight years ago in a small town called Lunsar.  Alex is married and has four children.  For ten years now, Alex has been managing a pharmacy. Mr. K. will use his share of the loan (SLL 1,500,000) to buy more medicines to add into his pharmacy.

loans.use: To buy more medicines for pharmacy

loans.name: Antony

texts.en: Antony is a 42-year-old married man with three children who are in school. He sells second-hand shoes to earn a living. He started the business ten years ago. His business has grown since he joined Faulu Kenya because he is able to access financial support. He sees himself becoming a successful businessman in the future. He has requested 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy shoes for resale.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale

loans.name: Hugo Rene

texts.es:
Don Hugo, se dedica a la venta de medicina, tiene 41 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, donde vive con esposa y dos hijo, tienen casa propia;  el negocio inicio luego que el saliera de ser un militar hace 10 años, se dedico a la venta de medicina como fuente de ingreso para su hogar.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de medicina, con esta ayuda estará adquiriendo mucha medicina para el inventario y tener a disponibilidad de los clientes.
Su visión es crecer en el campo de la medicina, ser buen cliente pagando puntualmente, y contar siempre con una fuente de ingreso para su hogar.
texts.en:
Don Hugo sells medicine.  He is 41 years old and lives in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután along with his wife and two children.  They have their own house.  After leaving the military ten years ago, he began selling medicine to provide his household’s source of income.

He is currently asking for a loan to buy medicine.  With this help, he can acquire a lot of medicine for his inventory and have it available for customers.  His vision is to grow in the field of medicine, be a good borrower paying punctually, and always have a source of income for his home.

loans.use: Buying medicine.

loans.name: Fairness Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Fairness” group. They are small-scale businesswomen in the northern city of Makeni. They have requested a loan of SLL 1,400,000 for each person in the group. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses. 

Rugiatu K. (pictured in the right) is the leader of this group. Rugiatu was born in Makeni. She is about forty years old and married to a businessman. They have four children. Rugiatu has twenty-two years of experience in business. She sells palm oil, rice, and clothing. With her share of this loan, she will buy gallons of palm oil, bags of rice and lots of clothing to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, rice and clothing to add to her stock

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en: Angeline is the mother of two children. She is able to raise her children with the income from her retail shop. She started the business two and a half years ago. Her business has grown since she joined Faulu Kenya, where she has received training on business management. She is also glad to be able to access financial support from Faulu Kenya. She has requested 20,000 Kes to buy cooking fat, sugar, corn flour, salt and soap.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, sugar, corn flour, salt and soap.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Doña Domitila, reside en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, donde vive con su hermana y la hija de su hermana, doña Domitila tiene 63 años de edad y administra una tienda que lleva 30 años de existir donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad y su ventaja es el no poseer competencia en el lugar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos para la tienda, como jabón, aceite, frijoles, arroz entre otros que son de mayor duración, este préstamo le ayudara a comprar estos productos antes mencionados y le ayudara también a ella a contar con mejores ventas.
Su objetivo es mantener el negocio, surtirlo y ofrecer lo mejor a los clientes, para recibir ingresos que le ayuden a cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Doña Domitila lives in San Miguel, in the department of the same name, with her sister and niece. She is 63 years old and has run a store for 30 years selling basic necessities. One advantage she has is that there is no competition in the area.

Domitila is seeking a loan to buy more goods for the store such as soap, oil, beans and rice, items that last a long time. This loan will help her obtain these products and lead to more sales. Her goal is to continue with the store, stock it well, and offer the best to her customers. That way she will earn enough money to cover her needs.

loans.use: to buy soap, oil, beans, rice.

loans.name: Virginia Ester

texts.es:
Doña Virginia, resiD. en Usulután, vive con sus hijos y su esposo, tiene 45 años D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. tablilla, tamales y meriendas, este negocio lo inicio hace 8 años con la ayuda D. sus hijos, pero por el momento quiere invertir y no cuenta con ahorros para poder realizar las compras necesarias D. materiales para la preparación D. sus productos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. maíz, condimentos, cacao y azúcar, así como productos para prepara las meriendas, este préstamo le ayudara a realizar la compra y a fortalecer el negocio para producir más e incrementar las ventas.
Tiene como propósito administrar bien los fondos del préstamo haciendo una buena inversión, pagar puntualmente y seguir creciendo en busca D. un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Doña Virginia lives in Usulután with her children and husband. She is 45 years old and earns her living by selling tablilla (a hot chocolate drink), tamales (local dish maD. from corn), and snacks. She started this business eight years ago with help from her children. She would now like to invest more money in it but she has no savings to buy the necessary ingredients.

Virginia is seeking a loan to buy corn, condiments, cocoa, sugar, as well as the ingredients she needs for snacks. The loan will help her buy these items and strengthen her business as she would be able to produce more and increase sales.

She plans to use the money wisely by investing it carefully, make her repayments on time, and continue developing, all in the search for a better future.

loans.use: to buy corn, condiments, cocoa, and sugar

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en: This is 42-year-old Rosaline. She is married with three children, aged 18, 12 and 8. She has two additional dependents who live with her: her nephew and her friend’s daughter. In 2003, Rosaline established her clothing business. She started her business because she wanted to be self-reliant. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about Le 2,841,600 every month. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to purchase more ladies' bags, blouses and jeans. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profit by approximately Le 426,240. In the future, Rosaline plans to grow her business, build a house and educate her children. Rosaline plans to re-invest her profit, and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional clothes

loans.name: Salvador Edenilson

texts.es:
Salvador, de 31 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposa y dos hijas, ellos tienen casa propia y se dedica a una panadería, este negocio tiene 5 años de existir y su historia comenzó como empleado de una panadería pero por su dedicación y buen aprendizaje decidió comenzar su propio negocio con poco material pero que hasta el momento le ha dado buenos resultados.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales y mejorar sus ventas, desea adquirir materiales como harina, azúcar, levadura; todo esto con la intención de aumentar su producción y ofrecer a los clientes, de esta manera ir creciendo en el mercado.
Salvador sueña con ser un gran empresario, ampliar su territorio de atención a clientes, darse a conocer con pueblos cercanos e ir mejorando sus productos.
texts.en:
Salvador is 31 years old.  He lives in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department, with his wife and two daughters in their own home.  Salvador runs a bakery.  He has had this business for 5 years.  He started off working as an employee in a bakery but, through his commitment and good training, he decided to set up his own business.  At first he didn't have much material but, up to now, he has had good results.

Salvador is requesting a loan to buy materials and to improve his sales.  He would like to acquire materials such as flour, sugar and yeast.  His goal is to increase his production and offer more to his customers.  In this way he will continue to grow in the market.

Salvador dreams of being a great businessman.  He would like to expand his sales area, become known in nearby towns and keep improving his products.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and yeast

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a soft-spoken woman who is blessed with a 12-year-old child. She sells clothing and bedding for a living.  She previously sold household goods.  Most of her customers are people in her neighborhood. It has been just one year since she started the business, and she has managed to grow it through Faulu Kenya. She hopes to own a business premise instead of renting. She will use the loan of 20,000 Kes to open a boutique.

loans.use: To open a clothing boutique

loans.name: Mujeres Inteligentes 4 Group

texts.en:
Antonio is the coordinator of his group Mujeres Inteligentes 4, or  "Smart Women." This is a group of Haitian citizens who are now located in an area of  Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water.  The water is not potable.

Antonio makes his home in a simple structure with his long-term partner and  4 children. He says that his most difficult challenges have been settling in a foreign city and helping his family.  He plans to continue doing business and enjoying the time he spends with his children.

Antonio is excited to be taking out his third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and growing his business. He has had his business for 8 years, starting with a candy stand. He plans to use this loan to purchase 3 bags of rice, 2 bags of sugar, 3 big cans of oil and beans for his business. He will use the profits to paint his home and to cover some expenses with his partner for Christmas. He is dreaming of improving his business and returning to Haiti to do a good business there.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because his Colmado (a small food market) needed capital to grow in products. His story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, oil and sugar

loans.name: Marjorie Del Rocio

texts.es:
Marjorie de 33 años, inicio hace 10 años con la papelería para poder ayudar con los gastos de su familia, vendiendo cuadernos, plumas y papeles a sus vecinos y conocidos pudo completar el dinero para ubicar su pequeña papelería readecuo su casa y la ubico en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Viviendo con su esposo que es artesano y sus dos hijos de 12 y 5 años en el suburbio de Guayaquil una zona caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales ha podido incrementa su mercadería en la papelería. Ella vende papeles, cuadernos, juguetes, plumas etc. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días  con ayuda de su mama. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas y vitrinas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere amplia su negocio incluyendo mercadería.
texts.en:
Marjorie is 33 years old.  She set up her stationery store 10 years ago so that she could help with her family's expenses.  She started by selling exercise books, pens and paper to her neighbors and acquaintances.  She was able to make enough money to set up a small stationery store and so she adapted her home and installed it in the front part of her home.

Marjorie lives with her husband, who is a craftsman, and her two children aged 12 and 5, in the suburb of Guayaquil, an area which is noted for the fact that most of its residents are informal salespeople.  Marjorie has been able to increase the merchandise in her stationery store.  She sells paper, exercise books, toys, pens, etc.  She works from 7.00am to 9.00pm every day with the help of her mom.

Marjorie will use her loan to buy exercise books, pens and display cases for her business.  In the future, she would like to expand her business and sell more goods.

loans.use: To buy stationery, pens and exercise books

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is 36 years old and married, with one 7 year-old child. She has three additional dependents who live with her. 

In 2000, Salamatu established her clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to be self-reliant. Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, Salamatu earns about Le 2,198,000 every month. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to purchase shoes, ladies' bags, jean skirts and jeans. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 32,9700. 

In the future, Salamatu plans to rent a shop and potentially establish an outlet. She also plans to help her husband educate their children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional clothes to sell

loans.name: Vilduvides Germania

texts.es:
Vilduvides de 47 años, siempre le gusto coser y confeccionar ropa pero como no tenía mucha experiencia decidió inscribirse en una institución que enseñan manualidades y diseño de ropa con confección. Viviendo en una zona urbana comenzó a promocionarse como costurera y confeccionista. 

Con la dedicación y esfuerzo que utilizo para que su negocio creciera le ayudo para que la gente del sector la conocieran y tenga una clientela fija. En la actualidad tiene 20 años trabajando  desde las 09h00am hasta las 20h00pm en su casa donde ubico su taller de costura y confección debido a la falta de dinero. Entrega vestidos, blusas, camisetas a un bajo costo. 

Ella tiene muchas aspiración para su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo telas, hilos para hacer nueva ropa. En el futuro quiere incrementar el taller para poder dar trabajo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Vilduvides is 47 years old.  She has always liked to sew and make clothes but as she didn't have much experience she decided to enrol at an institution where they teach handicrafts, clothes design and dressmaking.  Living in an urban area, Vilduvides started to promote herself as a seamstress and dressmaker.

Vilduvides put a lot of commitment and hard work into growing her business and this helped her to make herself known amongst the people in her area and to attract regular customers.  She has been working for 20 years, from 9.00am to 8.00pm, in her home which is where she set up her sewing and dressmaking workshop due to a lack of money.  She delivers dresses, blouses and t-shirts at low prices.

Vilduvides has a lot of plans for her business.  She would like to use her loan to buy fabric and thread to make new clothes.  In the future, she would like to expand her workshop so that she can provide other people with work.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cotton, lace and slippers

loans.name: Pedro Jorge

texts.es:
Pedro Jorge P. O. tiene 39 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijo 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS VENCEREMOS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto la America, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol gandul. 

Pedro se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López  y en Agripac en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un carro.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Pedro Jorge P. O. is 39 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and two children in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.  

He is a member of the UNIDOS VENCEREMOS farm co-op, located in an area called America which belongs to the Ventanas Canton.  This co-op grows short-cycle crops such as corn, rice and beans.

Pedro specializes in growing corn, rice and beans.  He buys products from Comercial López and Agripac in Ventanas, then sells them at the Ventanas market.

He is requesting a loan to buy farm equipment and fertilizer for his crops.  The loan will help him purchase items to combat plagues, disease and climate change.  He dreams of one day owning a car.

He enjoys being active in sports.

loans.use: To buy farm equipment and fertilizer

loans.name: Minkailu

texts.en:
Minkailu is 36 years old and married, with 4 children ages 18, 13, 11 and 4. In 2000, Minkailu established his cosmetics and household items business because he wanted to take care of his family. 

Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, Minkailu earns about Le 1,467,800 every month. He would like a loan of Le 4,000,000 to purchase new products. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 293,560. In the future, Minkailu plans to expand his business, build a house and educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional cosmetics and household items

loans.name: Carlos  Segundo

texts.es:
Carlos  Segundo A. L. tiene 41 años. Es soltero, vive con los padres, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. No  Tiene hijos
 
Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS VENCEREMOS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto la America, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol gandul. 

Carlos  se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López  y en Agripac en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es construir la casa.

Le gusta hacer deporte y andar en bicicleta.
texts.en:

texts.es:

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS VENCEREMOS  se encuentra ubicada a pocos minutos de la Oficina Ventanas en el recinto la América , perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Andrea Clemencia  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac, Agro insumos Karlita y Comercial Jiménez  los vende en la feria en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandu. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Andrea Clemencia has been growing corn, rice and beans for two years. She buys products from Agripac, Agro products Karlita and Comercial Jiménez, then sells them at the market in the same area.

texts.es:

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS VENCEREMOS  se encuentra ubicada a pocos minutos de la Oficina Ventanas en el recinto la América , perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Celso David A. A. is 30 years old and single.  He lives with his parents in  Ventanas in Los Ríos province. He has no children.  He likes sports.

The UNIDOS VENCEREMOS community bank in Ventanas is dedicated to the short-term agricultural cultivation of corn, rice, and gandul beans, which are labor-intensive.

Celso David has been farming corn, rice, and beans for the last two years. He buys his products from companies that sell them in the nearby market. Like other framers in the region, he faces problems like blight and adverse weather.

He will use this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer for growing corn, rice, and beans.  This funding will help him to meet his everyday needs.  His dream is to buy some land and grow cocoa.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer

texts.en:
Damarys Eugenia B. C. is 35 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children. She lives in the Ventanas canton in the province of  Los Ríos. She has 2 children.  

The members of the rural community bank UNIDOS VENCEREMOS  [Together we will Win] are a few minutes from the Ventanas Office in the community of  La América, which belongs to the Ventanas canton. This bank is dedictaed to short cycle agricultural work such as corn, rice and lima beans. They have been doing this for a long time.   

Damarys Eugenia works in agriculture. She has grown corn, rice, and lima beans for 2 years. She buys her products from Agripac, Agro Insumos Karlita, and Comercial Jiménez. She sells in the market of the same community.   

She is asking for the loan to buy agricultural materials and fertilizers to grow corn, rice and lima beans. The support of the loan would help her to meet her needs financially. She faces challenges such as pests and diseases and weather variation. Her dream is to buy a farm. 

She likes sports.

loans.use: Agricultural materials and fertilizers

loans.name: Nancy Pilar

texts.es:

UNIDOS VENCEREMOS  se encuentra ubicada a pocos minutos de la Oficina Ventanas en el recinto la América , perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Nancy Pilar B. C. is 30 years old.  She is single and lives alone in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She doesn't have any children.

The 'Unidos Venceremos' solidarity group is located a few minutes from our Ventanas office, in La Amércia district, in Ventanas canton.  This solidarity group works in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.  They have been doing this for a long time.

Nancy Pilar is a farmer.  She has been growing corn, rice and pigeon peas for 2 years.  She buys her products in Agripac, Agro Insumos Karlita and Comercial Jiménez and sells them in the market in the same district.

Nancy Pilar is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her corn, rice and pigeon pea crops.  The support of this loan will help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to travel to another country and buy a house.  She enjoys taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.es:
Sandra de 41 años,  es una mujer emprendedora que siempre ha querido ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos familiares por eso ella hace algunos años atrás comenzó a hacer cortes de cabello desde $ 2.00 c/u  en su casa a sus vecinos y conocidos. 

Viviendo en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos comenzó a promocionarse como estilista del sector. Aunque al principio de esta actividad económica ella tuvo inconvenientes por no tener un lugar donde atender a sus clientes esto no fue de impedimento para que continuara trabajando. Por la buena administración en la actualidad ella ya tiene un local donde tiene su salón de belleza y trabaja todos los días desde las 09h00 haciendo tratamientos, cortes de cabello, manicura, pedicura etc. 

Para seguir con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo sillas, tratamientos capilares, productos de belleza. En el futuro quiere tener uno de los gabinetes más grandes que se halla conocido en Playas.
texts.en:
Sandra is 41 years old.  She is an enterprising woman who has always wanted to help her husband with their family expenses.  For this reason, some years ago she started providing haircuts in her home, charging $2.00 upwards, for neighbors and acquaintances.

Sandra lives in a canton called Playas, one of Ecuador's tourist destinations that is noted for its wide variety of seafood.  Sandra began to promote herself as a stylist in her district.  Although she had some problems at the beginning because she didn't have anywhere to serve her customers, this wasn't an obstacle that would stop her working.  Through her good management of her business, she currently has premises for her beauty salon and she works every day from 9.00am providing treatments, haircuts, manicures, pedicures, etc.

To continue in her business, Sandra would like to use her loan to buy chairs, hair treatments and beauty products.  In the future, she would like to have one of the biggest salons that has ever been known in Playas.

loans.use: To buy chairs and hair treatments

The members of this solidarity group work in short-cycle agriculture growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.  They have been doing this for a long time.

loans.name: María Gladys

texts.es:
María Gladys es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito pesquero de San José, una localidad que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace 28 años a brindar servicio de costura en un pequeño taller que tiene instalado en un ambiente de su vivienda. Ella suele confeccionar prendas de vestir a medida de cada uno de sus clientes, asimismo también arregla prendas de vestir deterioradas. El negocio le ayuda a sentirse activa y le permite colaborar con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

María Gladys desea adquirir material para cumplir con algunos pedidos que sus clientes le han hecho por temporada navideña. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los cuales planea lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María Gladys is a 44 year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in the fishing district of San José, a town in Lambayeque province, more than twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For 28 years, María Gladys has been providing a sewing service in a small workshop that she has  in her home.  She usually makes made-to-measure garments for her customers.  She also mends clothes.  Her business helps her to feel active and allows her to help support her family financially.

María Gladys would like to acquire material so that she can fill some orders that her customers have made for the Christmas season.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy materials for her sewing business
